loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Gansuh is 34 years old and lives in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. He used to help his parents take care of livestock and produce organic dairy products and sell to local customers. He has a hearing disability and trained as a specialized cobbler in a specialized training course. Gansuh started his cobbler service business in 2012 right after he graduated the training course. He is now requesting 350,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) to purchase inventory for running his cobbler service business. He is a welcoming, hardworking and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for running his cobbler service.

loans.name: Gotitas De Chocolate Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GOTITAS DE CHOCOLATE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Zulema es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verdura, tienda de barrio, trenzado de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de joyas de fantasía.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Zulema es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeras del grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de joyas de fantasía; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió con ayuda de sus padres quienes le dieron el capital para emprender este negocio y en  la actualidad le ayuda a al sustento de su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de joyas de fantasía) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Gotitas de Chocolate community bank will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional center.  The group has eight members and is led by an executive board of which Zulema is the president.  The businesses that the members have are varied and include vegetable sales, a neighborhood store, braiding blankets, fruit sales, and sales of costume jewelry.  

Zulema is one of the female small-business owners who will benefit from this loan.  She joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of one of her friends in the group.  Currently she has a business selling costume jewelry.  She says she learned this business with the help of her parents, who gave her the capital to start the business and help her take care of her family.

She is requesting this loan to increase her capital and purchase costume jewelry from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto.  She will sell it at her sales location.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her household since she has a common-law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health area.

loans.use: to purchase costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida y su hijo de un mes de nacido, el se dedica a la venta de cereales y refrescos por mayor, se traslada en su vehículo por las diferentes tiendas y mercados que están cerca de su lugar en residencia ya tiene clientela fija que lo prefieren por los buenos precios y la calidad de sus productos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que ese es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The borrower lives in a rented house with his life partner and their one month old son.  He works selling cereal and soft drinks at wholesale.  He transports it in his vehicle to different stores and markets that are close to his home.  He has a fixed customer base who prefer him for his good prices and the quality of his products.  With the income he earns, he is able to meet his household expenses.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise for his store and perform maintenance on his vehicle since it is his only source of work.  This will allow him to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals and soft drinks at wholesale and to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and a general store business. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 50,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more dried fish to sell to her community.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her community.

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en:
Zareena, age 47, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers embroidery services which is the only source of income for his family. 

Zareena is requesting a loan, as a member of a two-persons lending group, from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase embroidery threads, needles, buttons of various colours and clothes for his business. This will help him to increase his sales and net income. 

With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Zareena hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery threads, needles, buttons of various colours and clothes for her husband's business.

loans.name: Yessika

texts.es: Yessika nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive  junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión de libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de confección de prendas, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana, telas, hilos, agujas y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Yessika was born in the city of Paucartambo, where she still lives with her family. She is 37 years old and is in a common-law marriage relationship from which she has two children. She is a hard working and enterprising person that helps her family get by with her efforts.

Her main economic activity is the sale of hand-made garments. She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to join the "Señor de Coyllority" communal bank. With this opportunity she requests the loan in order to buy work materials such as wool, fabric, thread, needles and other things. She is thankful for and values the loan and commits to fulfilling her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase work materials such as wool, fabric, thread, and needles

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su esposo y su madre, ella se dedica  a la venta de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, etc. vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y así poder ayudar a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: This client lives in her own house with her husband and her mother. She sells perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, etc. as a street vendor in different neighborhoods close to her residence. With her earnings from her sales and with her husband's help, they are able to pay for some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy more products wholesale to be able to continue with her business, which generates good income. This way, she can help her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.es:
El señor José Danilo de 32  años de edad el vive  con su espeso y su hijo en su casa de habitación ubicada en un caserío de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Don José Danilo su negocio es la venta de  pan, agua y palomitas de maíz en las pulperías,  se transporta en su carro a los diferentes lugares donde hay negocios para ofrecer sus productos, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  pan, agua y palomitas de maíz al por mayor para revender. 
Don José Danilo con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y tener mejores utilidades que le ayuden a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de  su familia. 
Don José Danilo su sueño es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante  su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
José Danilo is 32 years old. He lives with hie wife and son in their house located in the community of  San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras.
José Danilo's business is selling bread, water and popcorn in stores. He goes in his car to different places where there are businesses that can offer his products. He is asking for the loan to buy bread, water and popcorn to re-sell. 
 
With the help of the loan, José Danilo plans on improving his business and having more profits that will help him improve his and his family's quality of life a little. 

José Danilo's dream is to keep working and getting his family ahead.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2013.

loans.use: to buy bread, water and popcorn for his business.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en: A villager from Samrong district of Takeo province, Khorn is the mother of two children. She earns a living through animal husbandry (cow,chicken) and threading the silk pattern for a fee whereas her husband is a motorbike repairer in the area. She has been involved in her current business for ten years. Khorn is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan which she has fully repaid has enabled her to support her animal husbandry in a timely way and to make a decent profit to keep her kids in school. Now, in a group of three, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a proper latrine. She hopes this purchase will prevent her kids from getting relevant illnesses due to the lack of sanitation practice.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
Yim is 51 years old and a widow with six children. Nowadays, she has two children to cater to as they are in school. She strives for a living via rice farming and animal husbandry. Engaged in the current business for 20 years, she is able to earn up to 12,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. This is not the first loan for Yim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful loan, which she has paid back, she was able to support her animal raising on time and renovate her house on time. 

For this loan cycle, she leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a proper latrine for her family. She hopes to own a decent latrine for her family’s use to improve sanitation practices in her entire household.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce, leche, sopas y otra serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de  este comercio y la ayuda de su esposo  han sacado adelante a su familia. La clienta  busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, aceite, sopas, etc. lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
The customer lives in her own home with her husband and four children. She owns a small store where she sells perishable goods like soft drinks, candies, sweets, milk, soups along with a series of other edible and non-edible articles. 

Through this business, with the assistance of her husband, she's helped her family get by. The customer seeks to improve her quality of life. Which is why she's requesting a loan in order to increase the variety of articles in her store such as basic grains, soft drinks, candies, oil, soups, etc. This will allow her to increase her business' profits and improve the quality of life of her family group.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, candies, oil, soups, etc.

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es: Doña Maria es una madre soltera vive en casa propia, con su hijo de 24 años de edad el se dedica a la albañilería, Doña Maria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace varios años,  tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy amable y dedicada a su trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su hijo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Doña Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal  para la elaboración  de las tortillas y así mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su hijo.
texts.en: Maria is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her 24-year-old son, who is a bricklayer. Maria has been making and selling tortillas for several years. She has many customers because she is a very friendly person and is dedicated to her work. With the revenues she earns as well as with help from her son, they pay for some household expenses. Maria is requesting a loan to purchase corn wholesale and lime to make the tortillas and, thereby, improve her quality of life and have better financial stability for herself and her son.

loans.use: purchase corn wholesale and lime.

loans.name: 7 Palmeras Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 7 PALMERAS  Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un varon,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Dadny en la foto (la del centro con polera a rayas celeste y azul) tiene 31 años, tiene un hijito d ela edad de 9 años que se encuentra en edad escolar, La Sra.  Dadny se dedica a  la elaboración y venta de desayunos ella vende café y empanadas de manera ambulante por la zona donde ella vive, esta es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, utilizara el crédito en la  compra de harina  para la elaboración de empanadas,  y también para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de desayunos como azúcar y harina, café y distintos mates por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: The entrepreneurs' bank of 7 Palmeras is formed of nine members: eight women and one man. The president of the bank is Dadny. In the photo, she is in the center with the striped light and dark blue polo shirt. She is 31 years old. She has one little boy who is nine years old and is of school age. Dadny makes and sells breakfasts. She sells coffee and empanadas on the street in the area where she lives. This is her first loan cycle with this institution. She will use the loan to purchase flour for making empanadas as well as to purchase wholesale ingredients for making the breakfasts, such as sugar and flour, coffee, and certain sauces. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided because this is the only work that allows her to support her family.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make breakfasts.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive  junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta ropa, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como camisas, pantalones, blusas y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Miriam was born in the city of Paucartambo, and she lives with her family in the same city. She is 36 years old and is married, and through this beautiful marriage she has four children. She is a hard working and entrepreneurial person who moves forward with her family through the effort of her work. Her main business activity is selling clothes. She is a responsible person, and this is why they invited her to participate in the Señor de Coyllority communal bank. For this opportunity she needs a loan to purchase clothes such as shirts, pants, blouses, and other additional items. She is grateful for and values the loan, and she promises to make her payments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to purchase clothes such as shirts, pants, blouses, and other additional items.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, 58, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cresenciano, a farmer, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Juanita operates a market stall. She sells fruit and vegetable products in the community market. She buys fruits and vegetables and sells them by the kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. 

Juanita hopes to expand and have her own stall and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Carlos Jesus

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por desarrollarse la agricultura, en especial los cultivos de uva, algodón, entre otros. Carlos es un joven con muchas gnas de salir adelante, es por ello que a pesar de las adversidades se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma. Para poder solventar sus estudios trabaja como obreras en un fundo agrícola de su distrito. Carlos cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobretodo quiere ser un profesional para poder apoyar a su familia.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá solventar algunos gastos de sus estudios como materiales, uniformes, pasajes y algunos pagos que tiene que realizar a su universidad, de esta manera el seguirá estudiando y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser un gran profesional y poder apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young, 22-year-old man. He lives in the city of Ica in the district of Santiago, which is characterized by developing itself in agriculture, especially for crops of grapes, cotton, etc. Carlos is a young person with great hopes of succeeding; this is why, despite of all the adversities he faces, he is studying agricultural engineering. To be able to pay for his studies, he works as a staff member for an agricultural fund in his district. Carlos believes that he is moving forward because he is responsible and, above all, he wants to be a professional in order to be able to support his family.

Carlos is very grateful for the Kiva loans because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to pay for some school-related expenses, such as materials, uniforms, transportation, and some fees he has to pay at his university. This way, he will continue studying and will be able to continue fighting to bring his greatest dream into reality: to be a great businessman and be able to support his family.

loans.use: purchase materials and pay school expenses.

loans.name: Fehmar

texts.en:
Fehmar is 34 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Fehmar runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Fehmar has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Fehmar would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roselda

texts.en:
Roselda is 44 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Roselda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

Roselda has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Papitas De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PAPITAS DE SENKATA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cecilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de enaguas, producción de mantas de vicuña, librería, venta de api, venta de comida, venta de pescado, venta de carne de cerdo

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cecilia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas de grupo que son socias. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de enaguas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió cuando ayudaba a su madre al negocio familiar posteriormente decide establecer su negocio independiente y en la actualidad trabaja con sus hijas a quienes también enseñó el mismo oficio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente ala  elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito,  ahorro y el área de salud.

Al grupo acompaña la hija de una de las integrantes ella esta vcestida de negro.
texts.en:
The Papitas de Senkata communal bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Main Focus of Senkata. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors for which Cecilia is president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them are skirt-weaving, making llama blankets, a bookstore, selling api (a maize drink), selling food, selling fish, and selling pork.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-businesses, such as Cecilia's. She says that the first time she came to Pro Mujer, she was joining at the invitation of her friends who are members of the group. Now she has a business weaving and selling skirts. We have come to understand that she learned this business when she used to help her mother with the family business. Later, she decided to start her own business, and now she works with her daughters, and she is teaching them the same trade.

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase capital to purchase wool, which she will purchase from wholesale stores in the city of La Paz and later make to sell by order. This type of work allows her to generate revenue to support her family because she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loan, saving, and the health program.

The group is accompanied by the daughter of one of the members; she is dressed in black (in the photo).

loans.use: purchase wool.

loans.name: Oscar Isidro

texts.es: Don Oscar de 38 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa  y sus dos hijas de 11 y 9 años de edad quienes estudian  actualmente, es muy responsable y tiene como prioridad sacar adelante a sus dos hijas. Don oscar tiene un negocio de reparación  y venta de relojes desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, es una persona muy solicitada por sus  clientes pues es muy honesto en su trabajo,  además es una persona muy emprendedora y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos de sus gastos. Oscar  solicita un crédito para la compra de relojes, baterías para reloj y  brazaletes para atender mejor a sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias y así  mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Oscar is 38 years old and lives in the house of a relative with his wife and two children. They are aged 11 and 9 years old and they go to school. Oscar is very responsible and getting his children ahead is his priority. For the past number of years his business has been repairing and selling watches. His stall is located close to his residence. He is sought out by his customers as he is very honest in his work. Moreover he is a very enterprising person and with his income he has managed to pay off some of his expenses. Oscar is asking for this loan in order to buy watches, watch straps and batteries, to take better care of his customers, increase his profits and raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy watches and watch batteries and straps.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
Ayde, de 33 años es una mujer independiente. Vive en compañía de su esposo en su casa propia. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la comercialización de menestras, los cuales le otorgan un ingreso semanal y constante. Antes gustaba de la siembra, comenta que no deja de hacerlo pero solo para su propio consumo, ya que existen varios que se dedican a esa actividad. Ella no quiere ser una más, por eso emprendió este negocio nuevo y de ganancias estables. Ahora desea comprar un lugar estable en una zona de comercio para poder negociar sus menestras a buen precio y proyectarse a ser una empresaria mayorista. “Esa es mi meta, espero conseguirlo con el apoyo de mi esposo y mi familia”, afirma. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA,y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Ayde, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de menestras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ayde is an independent woman who is 33 years old. She lives with her husband in their own house. Her principal source of revenue comes from selling legumes, beans, peas etc., which gives her a constant weekly income. Before this she liked to plant food. She still does this but only for her own household consumption. As many people do this for a living, she didn't want to be just one more. So she started this new business with it's stable revenues. Now she wishes to buy a regular place in the marketplace to sell her product at a good price and one day become a wholesaler. "That is my goal, I hope to attain it with the help of my husband and family" she affirmed. 

This is her second loan with Kiva and she is very thankful for the assistance she has received so she can get ahead. And she promises to pay her installments in a punctual manner. Ayde will invest the 500 PEN buying legumes, beans and peas.

loans.use: to buy legumes, beans and peas wholesale.

loans.name: Chamampi Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHAMANPI SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ollas, tejido de mantas, carpintero, venta de mantas, producción de puertas, venta de papa, cerrajería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de mantas bordadas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió a muy corta edad, aprendiendo la técnica en un taller donde era operaria, posteriormente decide implementar su taller propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ceda) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The Chamampi Sartasiñani Communal Bank is entering its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Regional Office.  It is made up of eight members and it is governed by a board of directors, the president of which is Elsa.  The communal bank members do different types of work, such as selling pots, weaving blankets, carpentry, selling blankets, making doors, selling potatoes, and locksmithing.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small businesswomen, one of which is Elsa.  She tells us that she joined Pro Mujer nine years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business weaving and selling embroidered blankets.  She also tells us that she started this business when she was very young, learning her technique in a workshop where she was employed and later deciding to start her own shop.

The loan she is currently taking out is to increase her capital to buy silk, which she will get from distributors wholesale and which she will then embroider and sell at her shop.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married with five children. 
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she tells us that she likes the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy silk

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 64 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposo Julián, con quien convive desde hace 40 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Julia se dedica a la ganadería. Ella comenzó hace 20 años en está actividad,  la crianza de vacas. Ahora tiene 5 vacas lecheras y 3 becerros, que le brindan leche, con los que elabora queso; un promedio de 18 bolas diarios (quesos pequeños). Junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas, alverja y maíz los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues depende de sus cuidados las ganancias que obtendrá en la cosecha. Asimismo comenta que comenzó a incursionar en la crianza de gallos. Ahora su objetivo se centra en la mejora de sus sembríos y de sus animales, con trabajo y empeño sabe que lo conseguirá. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.
Julia, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de una vaca para mejorar su ganado.
texts.en:
Sixty-four-year-old Julia is a responsible woman.  She lives with her husband Julián, whom she has been with for 40 years.  Together they have nine children, but they only live with one of them in their home.  Julia raises livestock for a living.  She started this business 20 years ago raising cows.  She now has five dairy cows and three bull calves that provide her with milk, which she makes into cheese; approximately 18 small balls of cheese daily.  She and her husband work in farming.  Their main crops are potato, broad bean, pea, and corn, which they maintain with great care as the profits they receive from their harvest depend on their treatment.  She also tells us that she has started making incursions into raising roosters.  Her current goal centers around improving her crops and her animals and she knows that with work and determination she will achieve it.  This is her second loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the financial help she receives to get ahead.

Julia will use her 1,500 soles to buy a cow to improve her livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Abel Bonilla

texts.es:
El señor Abel de 45 años de edad es casado, tiene tres hijos que dependen de él, vive en una colonia San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de helados, su venta la realiza de manera ambulante sale de mañana todos los días en su motocicleta a visitar las escuelas, parques y lugares en donde hay presencia de niños ya que son sus clientes mas leales.
Don Abel Solicita 10,000.00 lempiras para la compra de ice crean, conos, vasitos, paletas y cremitas que son los productos que sus clientes prefieren, con el préstamo desea continuar trabajando y de esa manera proveer mas ingresos para su familia.
Don Abel  su sueño es darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y construir su casa ya que vive en casa de un familiar.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Abel is 45 years old, he is married and he has three children that depend on him. He lives in the San Lorenzo neighborhood in southern Honduras. 

For the past 10 years he has been selling ice cream for a living making his sales as a street vendor. He goes out in his motorcycle early in the morning every day and visits schools, parks and places where there are children since they are his most loyal customers. 

Abel requests 10,000.00 lempiras to purchase ice cream, cones, cups, ice pops and ice cream pops which are the products his clients prefer. With this loan he wishes to continue working and in this way provide a greater income for his family. Abel's dream is to provide a better education for his children and to build a house of his own, since he's living in a family member's house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2013.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, cones, cups, ice pops, and ice cream pops for his business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana  de 55  años de edad es soltera, tiene  01 hijo  que depende de ella,  vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 06 años  al negocio de venta de abarrotería como manteca, frijoles, azúcar, café, pan, agua, refrescos, churros, etc.. Sus clientes les prefieren por su amabilidad y buen trato.
Doña Juana es una mujer que ha luchado sola  durante mucho tiempo y gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante y  es un buen ejemplo de honestidad y trabajo.
Doña Juana está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de verduras, pollo, café, arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, pan, agua, etc.  Ya que tiene mucha demanda,  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y de esa manera sacar  adelante a su familia.
Doña Juana está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con PRISMA y esta agradecida porque los préstamo le han ayudado mucho a su negocio y a su economía.
Doña Juana su sueño es mejorar  su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Juana is 55 years old, single, and has one dependent son.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  She has her own home and for six years she has had a grocery business selling things like lard, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, water, soft drinks, churros, etc. Her customers prefer her for her friendliness and good customer service.

Juana is a woman who has struggled on her own for a long time and, thanks to her efforts, she has been able to get ahead.  She is a good example of honesty and work.  

Juana is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, chicken, coffee, rice, sugar, lard, beans, bread, water, etc.  As her demand is high, she plans to use this loan to improve her profits and get her family ahead.

Juana is very happy to still be working with PRISMA and she is thankful because the loans have helped her a lot with her business and her finances.

Juana's dream is to improve her home. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, coffee, rice, sugar, lard, beans, bread, water, etc. for her business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive  junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de celulares pues tiene una pequeña tienda pero también se dedica a la enseñanza, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar celulares y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Hilda was born in the city of Paucartambo and she lives with her family in the same city.  She is 32 years old, married, and has three children.  She is a hardworking and enterprising person who gets her family ahead with the fruit of her work.  Her primary business activity is selling cell phones, as she has a small store, but she also teaches for a living.  She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Señor de Coyllority Communal Bank, and she currently needs a loan to buy cell phones and other things.  She is thankful for and appreciates her loan and she promises to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and other things

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley, a 59-year-old father of five from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Jane who helps him in farming. He earns a monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to support his family. This marks his third loan term with KADET. 

With the loan he has applied for from KADET LTD, he will be able to purchase animal feed and expand the animal shed. Additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. In the future, Stanley would like to build a permanent store to keep his cereals and other grains. 

He hopes to save money to educate his children to the college level.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and expand the animal shed

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock and a computer gaming station business. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 40000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional items including sardines, snack foods and other groceries.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional items including sardines, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 43 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosie has a variety store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, noodles and other miscellaneous items.

Rosie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, noodles and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Roberta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Roberta is borrowing PHP 24000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Roberta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: Juan Angel es un pequeño productor que vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua. En su pequeña finca cultiva malanga y café como principal actividad económica. Es parte del grupo de productores afiliados a la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) que está dentro del proceso de certificación Comercio Justo. El principal reto para este productor es hacerle frente a las enfermedades del café, lo cual asegura ha podido lograr con un buen mantenimiento. Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para su cafetal. Su meta es ampliar el área de café en su finca para aumentar los ingresos y condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Angel is a small producer who lives with his wife and four children in a rural community in Nicaruagua. He has a small farm where he cultivates malanga (a tuber similar to taro) and coffee as his main business activity. Juan Angel is part of a group of producers that is affiliated with the Association for People in Community Action (PAC) and in the process of becoming certified Fair Trade growers. The main challenge for this producer is dealing with coffee plant diseases, so he must be confident that his crops are well-maintained.

For this crop cycle, Juan Angel is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies and fertilizers for his coffee farm. His goal is to expand the space on his farm for growing coffee so that he can increase his earnings and improve his family’s condition.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 4 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne  26 ans et 1 enfant. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Moussabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Bako (1ère   femme debout à gauche  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Moussabougou.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women who make up the BENKADI 4 group are all married within traditional families.  They are, on average, 26 years old and also have an average of one child each. They all live in the village of Moussabougou, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).  They know one another through their farming activities during the rainy season, and also through ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship within the village.  They grow groundnuts, millet and rice.

In order to buy small tools, to stock up on farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in their fields, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second cycle of farming loan.

Bako (standing first from the left in the photo), is an important leader of farming activities during the rainy season in the village of Moussabougou.  She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farm inputs in Ségou, as well as small tools from local blacksmiths. She will also hire young people to weed her field.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season, and she uses her earnings to repay her loan, to take care of her children, and to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds, farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in her field.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr: Les dix femmes de Benkadi 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne  46 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Zankourabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Diabane (1ère   femme debout à gauche  dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Zankourabougou.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women who make up the BENKADI 1 group are all married within traditional families. They are, on average, 46 years old and also have an average of three children each. They all live in the village of Zankourabougou, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through their farming activities during the rainy season, and also through ties of neighborhood, marriage and kinship within the village. They grow groundnuts, millet and rice.

In order to buy small tools, to stock up on farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in their fields, the members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third cycle of farming loan.

Diabane (in the standing row, first from the left in the photo), is an important leader of farming activities during the rainy season in the village of Zankourabougou. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farm inputs in Ségou, as well as small tools from local blacksmiths. She will also hire young people to weed her field.

She sells her crops for cash at the end of the rainy season, and she uses her earnings to repay her loan, to take care of her children, and to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy small tools, seeds, farm inputs, and to cover the cost of weeding in her field.

loans.name: Jacqueline Elizabeth

texts.es: Jacquelin de 38 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposo el cual trabaja en una ferretería  y sus hijos de 17, 10 y 8 años de edad quienes estudian actualmente, Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, joyería, perfumes lociones, y zapatos desde hace 3 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, es una  persona muy emprendedora, responsable y dedicada a su trabajo ella posee una gran demanda de sus productos en la zona donde los comercializa gracias a su amable atención con sus clientes, siempre es muy solicitada. Jacquelin solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de más mercadería por mayor para poder incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her husband, who works in a hardware store, and their children, who are 17, 10 and 8 years old and are studying. 

She has been selling clothes, jewellery, perfumes, lotions and shoes for three years, running her business from her own home. She is a very enterprising and responsible person who is dedicated to her work. There is great demand for the products she sells in her area and thanks to the friendly service she offers her clients, she is always greatly sought after. 

Jacqueline is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise in bulk to increase her earnings and improve both her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, jewellery, perfumes, lotions and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is a 34-year-old farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Pablo is a married man and has two children, ages 14 and 9.

He grows rice in his field. This is the source of his income. Pablo has been in the business for more than 10 years now. 

Pablo works hard to support his family, especially in sending his children to school. As of now, he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, Pablo will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting his yield and income. In the future, Pablo hopes to make his farming venture a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia, 52, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rene and a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lydia operates a bridal gown retailing business. What she basically does is buy bridal gown products from her suppliers and sells them with a profit. Her products are bridal gowns and dresses. Her regular customers are people in the local community. She earns a minimum of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of bridal gowns and dresses to expand her product inventory.

Lydia hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of bridal gowns and dresses to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Ángel  de 30  años, vive con su esposa e hijos  en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de Nacaome Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10  años a la venta de productos lactaos, como ser cuajada, mantequilla, queso y también a la venta de ganado y cargas de maíz.
Don Ángel vende de sus productos de lunes a domingo y sale a entregar todos sus pedidos a sus clientes que le prefieren por la calidad de su producto.
Don Ángel está solicitando  el préstamo para comprar producto como ser fertilizantes, y vacunas para su ganado, los fertilizantes los necesita para cultivo de maíz, espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar su negocio, su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Don Ángel su sueño ampliar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Ángel is 30 years old and lives with his wife and children in his home in a small village in Nacaome, Valle in southern Honduras.  For ten years he has been selling dairy products, such as curd, butter, and cheese, and he also sells livestock and loads of corn.  

Ángel sells his products Monday through Sunday and he delivers all his orders to his customers, who prefer him because of the quality of his products.

Ángel is asking for this loan to buy products such as fertilizers and vaccines for his livestock.  He needs the fertilizers for his corn crop.  He hopes this investment will help him improve his business and his and his family's quality of life.  

Ángel's dream is to expand his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2013.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and vaccines for his business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 46 years old and married with three children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Marivic aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Andrea Concepcion

texts.es:
Andrea es una joven con muchos sueños y muchos deseos de salir adelante, superarse en la vida al lado de sus familiares y demás la cual tiene una edad de 23 años, es soltera y graduada como maestra de primaria. Actualmente estudia en la universidad y vive con sus padres ella se dedica a la siembra, cultivo y venta de café hace más de 3 años siendo sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar, mismos que le heredaron la tierra que hoy día trabaja siendo sus clientes los vecinos de las zonas aledañas en donde ella vive. A su lugar de trabajo se desplaza en bus ya que está retirado de donde ella vive.

Ella sueña con ser la mayor productora de la zona manteniendo sus cultivos al 100% haciéndolo atractivo para sus clientes como también invirtiendo en la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares, etc. para preparar su producto de una mejor y más segura forma para la próxima cosecha.

Para el futuro su deseo es poderse graduar de la universidad ya que de esa forma ella personalmente habrá conseguido un logro más en su vida y podrá ayudar a sus padres en todo lo que pueda aportar para su bienestar.
texts.en:
Andrea is a young woman with a dream and a desire to get ahead and to improve herself and her life alongside her family. She is 23, 
single, and graduated as a primary school teacher. Now, she studies at the university and lives with her parents. She is dedicated to the cultivation of coffee, growing and selling it for more than three years now. It was her parents who taught her how to do this, and they who handed down to her the land she works on. Her customers are people who live nearby to her. She takes a bus to her work because it is far away from where she lives.

She dreams of being the biggest producer in her area, maintaining her plants at 100%, making her business attractive to customers. She wants to invest in the purchase of manure and fertilizers for both soil and leaves, in order to produce a better and more secure product in the next harvest.

In the future she hopes to be able to graduate from the university because that way she will have personally achieved another milestone in her life, and she will be able to support her parents with everything she can give them for their well-being.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Faraja Mavurunza Group

texts.en:
Nuru, a member of Faraja Mavurunza group, has been managing a business selling clothes (fabrics and sarongs) door to door. She currently operates three different activities: her clothes-selling business that enabled Nuru to start her other two businesses: running a broiler and selling local chickens. Nuru, who is in her early 30s with a boy attending school, has been in her businesses for fours years now. She is working hard to see her businesses doing better. Nuru works from 9 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good return each month. 

This is her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start her two chicken businesses. She also bought more stock of clothes for her other business. Nuru has paid back all her previous loans successfully. With the profit received, she covered school fees and household expenses and started a building. She will use this loan to buy more local chickens and clothes to resell. Nuru dreams that one day she will be able to build a premise for her clothes business.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Faraja Mavurunza", which includes eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more local chickens and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is a 21-year-old unmarried lady. She is been in the beauty parlor business for two years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to have more customers time after time. For this reason, she requires packs of makeup kits, lipsticks and cleansers in a large quantity so she applied for a loan of Rs 30,000 through Kashf Foundation.  She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of makeup kits, lipsticks and cleansers

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is 33 years old, married and a mother of three. Her husband’s income is insufficient for their family expenditures. To meet her household expenditures efficiently, six years ago she decided to start a stitching business at her home. She is expert in stitching stylish dresses. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. So she contacted Kashf Foundation for a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces and zippers. She is hoping to get an increase in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her income on the betterment of her family members. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 50-year-old married woman.  She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and a good client list. Her husband’s income is insufficient to support his family alone.  She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy more stock of grains and pulses along with packs of cleaning products including detergents and soaps. She wishes to spend part of her revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy grains and pulses along cleaning products including detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: Carmen Rosa nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive  junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 31 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de útiles como por ejemplo lapiceros, cuadernos, lápices, borradores, papeles, libros y otros cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos y libros, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Carmen Rosa was born in Paucartambo and lives there with her family. She is 31 years old, in a civil union, and has one son. A very hard-working woman, she has an enterprising spirit and supports her family through her hard work. Her main economic activity consists in selling school supplies, such as pens, notebooks, pencils, erasers, paper, books, and other items. Carmen Rosa is a very responsible person, a fact which netted her an invitation to be part of Señor de Coyllority communal bank. She asks for a loan to buy notebooks and books to sell. She is very grateful for the loan and values the opportunity it affords her, and promises to be punctual in her repayments, because that is what responsible people do.

loans.use: to buy notebooks and books to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les dix femmes de Benkadi 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne  42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Zankourabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Kadia (2ème femme assise de la gauche vers la droite   dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Zankourabougou.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are all married women who live in traditional families. They have an average age of 42 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the village of Zankourabougou, in the Ségou region, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They got to know each other through their agricultural activities in the village, and thanks to neighbourly and family relationships and marriage. They grow groundnuts, millet and rice. The group members joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to buy small equipment and agricultural inputs and to pay the labourers who weed their fields, and are on their 3rd group loan.

Kadia, sitting second on the left of the picture, is a big agricultural grower during the rainy season in the village of Zankourabougou. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and agricultural inputs in Ségou, some small equipment from the local blacksmiths and to pay the young labourers to weed her field. At the end of the rainy season, her agricultural produce will be sold for cash so that she can repay her loan and have enough income to take care of her children and some of her family.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seeds and agricultural inputs and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr: Les dix femmes de Benkadi 3 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne  38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Zankourabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Madame Kadia 1 ère debout de la gauche vers la  droite compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.

The group members joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to buy small equipment and agricultural inputs and to pay the labourers who weed their fields, and are on their 3rd group loan.

Kadia, standing on the left of the picture, plans to use her loan to buy seeds and agricultural inputs in Ségou, some small equipment from the local blacksmiths and to pay the young labourers to weed her field. At the end of the rainy season, her agricultural produce will be sold for cash so that she can repay her loan and have enough income to take care of her children and some of her family.

loans.use: small equipment and agricultural inputs and to pay the labourers who weed their fields

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 4 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne  35 ans et 3 enfants. They all live in the village of Zankourabougou, in the Ségou region, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They got to know each other through their agricultural activities in the village, and thanks to neighbourly and family relationships and marriage. They grow groundnuts, millet and rice. The group members joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to buy small equipment and agricultural inputs and to pay the labourers who weed their fields, and are on their 3rd group loan.

Aminata, standing on the left of the picture, plans to use her loan to buy seeds and agricultural inputs in Ségou, some small equipment from the local blacksmiths and to pay the young labourers to weed her field. At the end of the rainy season, her agricultural produce will be sold for cash so that she can repay her loan and have enough income to take care of her children and some of her family.

loans.use: to buy small equipment and agricultural inputs and to pay the labourers for weeding their fields.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 51 year old married woman operating a milk sales business for the past 10 years. She has 3 buffaloes in milk production and she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life.  

She is the mother of seven children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life.  It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with their support.

She has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to increase the milk production capacity which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 37 años es una valiente madre de familia. Vive en la casa que alquiló hace 16 años junto a sus dos hijos. Su principal ingreso económico se centra en la venta de queso y leche al por mayor, ya tiene muchos años dedicándose a este negocio  por lo que tiene mucha demanda. Durante los primeros días del mes compra varios moldes de queso entre los ganaderos, asimismo leche por litros. Después de adquirir lo suficiente, viaja a la ciudad más cercana por una hora y media. Después lleva los alimentos a sus clientes quienes ya anteriormente realizarón los pedidos. “Me va muy bien en mi trabajo, pues la leche y queso que se producen en mi pueblo, son de calidad y sabor diferente, por esa razón tengo muchos clientes”, comenta, es así que Edith viaja cada 15 días a un pueblo cercano para realizar su negocio. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Edith, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de mercadería entre quesos y leche al por mayor para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Edith, 37, is a brave mother. She lives with her two children in a house she has been renting for sixteen years. Her income comes mainly from selling cheese and milk in bulk, and she has been doing this for many years since these products have a high demand. The first days of every month, she buys several blocks of cheese and milk by the liter. After buying enough, she has to travel for an hour and a half to the closest city. She then delivers the orders to customers that have previously put them.

“I do well with my job, since the milk and cheese that are produced in my town have good quality and taste different. This is why I have a lot of customers,” she says. Edith travels fortnightly to a nearby town to sell her products. This is her second loan with Kiva and she appreciates the financial support she is receiving to get ahead. She promises to pay the installments on time. Edith will use the 1,500 soles [PEN] to buy cheese and milk in bulk to sell.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese in bulk.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 39 лет, замужем и имеет 4 детей (2 сына и 2 дочери). Назира имеет средне-специальное образование. Назира известна как принципиальный, честный и добросердечный человек. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1993 году Назира начала свой бизнес в откорме скота. Стартовав с 3,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Назиры имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка. Также имеет земельный надел размером 1,27 ГА, где в основном выращивают фасоль и болгарский перец. Доходы от бизнеса Назира вложила в оплату за образование своих детей. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закупку скота. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота, а также намерена приготовить приданное для старшей дочери.
texts.en: Nazira is 39 years old, she is married and has four children (two sons and two daughters). Nazira has specialized secondary education. Nazira is knows as a principled, honest and kind woman. While looking for a source of income for her family in 1993 Nazira has started her business feeding cattle. She started with an amount of 3,000 som (KGS) and today her business brings her a monthly income in the amount of 8,000 KGS. Nazira has two milk cows and two calves in her business. She also has a plot of land of 1.27 hectares where she mainly grows beans and sweet pepper. Nazira invested the income from the business into her children's education. To further grow her business Nazira has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy cattle. Nazira plans to use the income from the loan to increase the headcount of cattle and also to prepare dowry for her older daughter.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer dedicada a la enseñanza principalmente de los niños, ya que su profesión es  maestra de educación primaria,  con 29 años  de desempeñarse como docente, es  acompañada ,  con 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, a quienes les da todo el apoyo para su desarrollo ,actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda como es la construcción de un cuarto, por eso visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de, ladrillo rojo , cemento, zinc, cerámica, hierro y mano de obra la que le brindara mejores condiciones en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Margarita teaches small kids; she is a primary school teacher. She has been a teacher for 29 years. She lives in a relationship and has two underage children under her care; she gives them all her support so that they can get ahead. 

Margarita needs to make some home improvements. She needs to build a room and that is why she came to CEPRODEL. She is requesting a loan to buy red bricks, cement, zinc, tiles and iron, and to pay for the labor needed to make the improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy red bricks, cement, zinc, tiles and iron and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson is 37 years old, and is married with four children, who all attend school. Gibson lives in Kongowea, Kenya, where he owns a retail shop. He has been running this business for three years now. He also owns a poultry farm.

He heard of Milango through friends, and he now seeks a loan to buy maize flour, salt, cooking fat, greengrams (mung beans) and eggs to sell. Gibson's major challenges in his business are a lack of financing and competition. Gibson also wants to use part of the loan to buy poultry feed. 

The extra income from the business will go towards paying school fees for his children. His living standards will also improve as a result of the loan use.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, salt, cooking fat, greengrams (mung beans) and eggs to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 57 years old, and is a married mother of two. 

It is very tough for Kousar to manage her household needs with her husband's small. Therefore, she decided to help her husband earn. So, she started her business of selling cloth - she buys cloths in different varities from the wholesale market and then sells in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Kousar is requesting a loan of 25,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on providing a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: Don José de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija de 20 años de edad quien  estudia actualmente. Él se dedica a la venta de camisas para caballeros desde hace varios años, es una persona honrada y amable con sus clientes por esta razón posee una gran clientela establecida en la zona donde comercializa su producto. Don José solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de camisas por mayor  para poder incrementar su mercadería y así obtener mayores ganancias para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida y seguridad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 20-year-old daughter, who is currently studying. For several years he has earned a living selling men's shirts. He is honest and friendly to his clients and so he has a large established clientele in the area where he sells. 

José is asking for a loan to buy shirts wholesale to increase his merchandise and so make better profits so he can give his family economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shirts wholesale.

loans.name: Manuela Teresa

texts.es: La Señora Manuela  Teresa , es una  señora preocupada por la enseñanza de los demás, de profesión  Licenciada en ciencias sociales, se desempeña como maestra de educación secundaria en un instituto de la localidad con 26  años de laborar,  es  soltera  con 3 persona  hijo al que le está brindando el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de construir un cuarto, por tal razón se acerco a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y lograr el objetivo  planteado, ya que lo utilizaría en la compra de Cerámica, cemento, arena, ladrillo tamaño bloque, zinc y mano de obra. Ya que dicha obra le ayudaría a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Manuela Teresa is interested in teaching others. She has a degree in social sciences and has been a secondary school teacher at a local institution for 26 years. She is single with 3 children who she is providing the necessary support for as they grow up. 

Currently she needs to build a room, which is why she approached Ceprodel for a loan to be able to do this. She would use the loan to buy tiles, cement, sand, brick blocks and zinc and pay for labour. This project would help her to improve her living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement, sand, brick blocks and zinc and pay for labour.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr: Les dix femmes de Benkadi 5 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne  35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Zankourabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Oumou (3ème  femme assise au milieu des assises dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Zankourabougou.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ.
