La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 women in the Benkadi 5 group are all married and live in traditional families. They have an average age of 35 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in the village of Zankourabougou, in the Ségou region, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They got to know each other through their agricultural activities in the village, and thanks to neighbourly and family relationships and marriage. They grow groundnuts, millet and rice. The group members joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to buy small equipment and agricultural inputs and to pay the labourers who weed their fields, and are on their 3rd group loan.

Oumou, sitting in the middle in the picture, is a big agricultural grower in the village of Zankourabougou during the rainy season. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and agricultural inputs in Ségou, some small equipment from the local blacksmiths and to pay the young labourers to weed her field. At the end of the rainy season, her agricultural produce will be sold for cash so that she can repay her loan and have enough income to take care of her children and some of her family.

loans.use: to buy small equipment and agricultural inputs and to pay the labourers for weeding their fields.

loans.name: Las Ovejas De Cristo Group

texts.es:
Las ovejas de Cristo  esta conformado por nueve integrantes, siete mujeres y dos hombres,  madres y padres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas personas son originarias de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de tiempo de calidad con sus hijos. Le preparan comida típica de la región como cosa de horno. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar estudios y se vieron obligados  a trabajar desde temprana edad. Ellos luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos.

La coordinadora del banco es Claudia  y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leña, pan, huevos, detergentes, jabón, jugos, leche. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal las Ovejas de Cristo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para  tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The group "Las Ovejas de Cristo" [Christ's sheep] is made up of 9 members, seven women and two men, all mothers and fathers with 15 children under their responsibility. These people come from Malpaisillo, a place which is in the North of the country. In their free time they like to spend quality time with their children. They make them typical food from the region such as "cosa del horno" [bread made from corn, cinnamon and sugar]. Unfortunately due to lack of resources they were unable to have an education and had to work from a young age. They work hard every day to give their small children a better future.

Claudia is the co-ordinator of the communal bank and she runs a pulpería from her home. A pulpería is a small shop selling food products in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, eggs, fruit juice and milk as well as firewood, detergents and soap. She works 12 hours a day in her business selling her products.

The purpose of the loan is to have working capital and buy a stock of food products to sell in the shop. In the not-too-distant future she hopes to be able to have a better income.

The Ovejas de Cristo communal bank is grateful for the support which Kiva lenders give to people on low incomes in poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to have working capital and buy a stock of food products to sell such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, eggs, fruit juice and milk as well as firewood, detergents and soap.

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kasereka est trésorière du collectif  d’affaire  « Ahadi», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 37 ans et mère de 2 enfants  qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un ingénier mécanicien. La cliente est vendeuse d’habillement (pagnes). Elle installe ses articles au marché, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de  son mari,  il y a environ 6 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Kasereka, the customer, is the treasurer of the "Ahadi" business group. A young and experienced entrepreneur of 37 years of age, she is the mother of 2 children who both attend school. Her spouse is a mechanical engineer. She sells clothing; pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth). She sells her merchandise at the market and occasionally at home. She started her business about 6 years ago with her own funds which she received from her husband. This new loan will be used to buy 10 pieces of pagnes. She wishes to increase her business and feed and educate her children. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for the support it provides to small entrepreneurs in the form of microloans.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of pagnes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Calacoto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CALACOTO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de madera, venta de muebles, veta de dulces, elaboración de mantas bordadas, venta de comida, salón de belleza, albañil.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ollas; da a conocer que este negocio lo realizó hace ocho años, siendo este la fuente de sustento familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ollas) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “CALACOTO” communal bank is in its seventh cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the German Busch center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors of which Julia is the president. The businesses the members of the association have are varied. Among them, are a neighborhood store, selling wood, selling candy, making embroidered cloths, selling food, a beauty salon, and bricklaying. 

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-business women, among them is Julia. She says that three years ago she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has business selling pots. She says she has done this business for eight years. This is the source of her family's support.
 
the loan she will take out is to increase capital (buying pots) that she will acquire from distributors wholesale and later sell  as a street vendor in the markets of the city of El Alto. This work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has six children.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the area of health.

loans.use: to buy pots.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: Maria de 53 años de edad  es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija de 26 años de edad, ella tiene un comedor cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios tiene mucha clientela por vender sus platos de comida a un buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña maría está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ingredientes para elaborar sus alimentos como: arroz, pollo, carne, verdura, fruta, maíz, etc. Para poder seguir con su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida con su hija.
texts.en: Maria is 53 years old. She is a single mother who lives with her 26 year old daughter. She has had a restaurant close to her home for several years. She has a lot of customers because she sells her dishes at a good price. With the profits she gets from her work, she is able to pay for her household expenses. María is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make her food, such as rice, chicken, beef, vegetables, fruit, corn, etc., to be able to have a better quality of life with her daughter.  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ingredientes para elaborar sus alimentos como: arroz, pollo, carne, verdura, fruta, maíz, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, beef, vegetables, fruit, corn, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Melanio

texts.es:
El  señor  Cesar  es una persona muy emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora que  vive con sus hijos 2 hijos y su esposa en una comunidad al sur  de  Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de Ganado el  cual  le brinda la mayor parte de sus ingresos. 
Don Cesar el préstamo lo necesita para comprar  más ganado,  debido a que tienen bastante demanda por sus clientes y para poder cumplir con todas  necesita el crédito ya que el no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar más producto.
Don Cesar vende en los alrededores de su comunidad y sectores aledaños a ella, entre otros lugares cercanos.  En unos años el sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo y le brinde los ingresos necesarios para poder tener una calidad de vida mejor y apoyar a sus hijos en  sus estudios para que tengan mas oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Julio  del 2013
texts.en:
Cesar is a very enterprising, responsible, and hardworking person who lives with his 2 children and his wife in a community in southern Honduras. His business is selling cattle, which brings in most of his income. 
 
Cesar needs the loan to buy more cattle, because there is a lot of demand from his customers and to fill them all he needs the loan, since he doesn't have the money he needs to buy more product.  

Cesar sells n the areas surrounding his community and other nearby areas. He dreams of his business growing in a few years and bringing in the income he needs to have a better quality of life and help his children have more opportunities in life.



Choluteca, Honduras –  July, 2013

loans.use: to buy cows for his business.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar is a 31-year-old married woman. After she got married, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial conditions. Therefore, she started a business selling cloth. She buys a variety of cloth from the main city market and sells it to the people of her area. She has become famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. She needs a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase good quality cloth in different colors and designs. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This will lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good quality cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida, 42, has been in the beauty parlor business since three years ago. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to continue growing her customer base. For this, she requires packs of hair rollers, makeup kits and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She is in her 4th loan cycle, and has a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy packs of hair rollers, makeup kits and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad, 50, is a vigorous, married woman and the mother of five children. She has had a business of hand embroidery for the past five years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. However, business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Shamshad’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is a 32-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past three years, has been running a business selling clothes. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Sakeena expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mariatu from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 2 and 8 years. She began this business because she wants to empower her life and children.

Mariatu runs a fish business; she sells fish within the busy market area. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more raw fish for the business for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more raw fish for the business for resale

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela, age 41, is a married woman. She is been in beauty parlor business for a period of about six years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her providing the best services, she has become very famous in her street.

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor.  But, because of having low cash on hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her fifth loan.

She needs a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy large quantities of hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time.  She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal is a 49-year-old widowed woman and a mother of six. She has been doing the business of tailoring for 15 years to provide her family with bread and butter.

After the death of her husband, she has to work hard to bear the expenses of her household along with the educational needs of her children. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons to meet up with the increasing demand.  She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr: Dodji est un jeune homme célibataire de 29ans. Il est revendeur de chaussures et habits dans une boutique et rencontre par moment de la concurrence sur le marché. Il est dans ce domaine il y a 05ans et sollicite un troisième crédit dans notre institution WAGES pour acheter des chaussures et habits. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité, avoir d’autres boutiques et disposer un pouvoir d’achat au dessus de la moyenne pour fonder un foyer plus tard.
texts.en: Dodji is a young, single man who is 29 years of age. He works reselling shoes and clothes in a shop and currently faces competition in the market. He has worked in this sector for five years, and is asking for a third loan from the WAGES institution in order to buy shoes and clothes. He wants to reinvest in the business, have other shops, and have above-average purchasing power available so that he can set up a home later on.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 28-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Samina’s husband. They have been running a food stall for a period of about two years.  They enjoy making food and have become famous in their town for providing the best breakfast. They are earning enough to lead a decent life.

Samina is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to bear the daily expenditures of her family members. That is why she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a stock of rice and grains along with packs of oil, salt and spices.  It will allow them to cater to more customers time after time. She wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s education and well being.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and grains along with packs of oil, salt and spices

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Ramatu from Waterloo, in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children, between the ages of 4 and 15.  

In 2000, Ramatu established her food market business. She began her business because she wanted to create her own source of income to contribute to taking care of the children. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and coconut oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Ramatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and coconut oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 24-year-old lady who enjoys doing hand embroidery. Through her hand embroidery, she creates beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to complete her customers' orders on time. She dreams of her children having a bright future and desires to provide them with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for  embellishment.

loans.name: Monrovia Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, who was born in the early 1960s, is married with three boys and a girl, who are in school. For seven years now, Zainabu has had two food businesses. She has a fruits and vegetable business, working from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily, and a chips business, where she has a helper from 4 p.m. to 11 p.m. She usually joins work with her helper after closing her genge business. Zainabu is able to make a good profit per month. 

This is her tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which will be used to buy chickens which are mostly demanded by her chips customers. With the previous loans, all of which paid back successfully, she bought sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil and eggs. She used her business profit to cover school fees and home expenses. Zainabu wishes to one day be in a position to finish building her house.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group, "Monrovia", which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens which are mostly demanded by her chips customers.

loans.name: Abashakashatsi Group

texts.fr:
Liberate fait partie du groupe  Abashakashatsi et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 46 ans et est mariée à  Augustin, un commerçant.

Elle fait le commerce des habits depuis 20 ans.

Elle est à son sixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et  acheter beaucoup d'habits  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle  voudrait construire une maison et voir ses enfants continuer leurs études.
texts.en: Liberate is part of the Abashakashatsi group and she lives in Bujumbura. She is 46-years-old and is married to Augustin, a shopkeeper. She has run a clothing business for 20 years. She is on her sixth loan with Turame. With the KIVA credit she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing to resell in order to make more money. In the years to come, she would like to build a house and to see her children continue their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy more clothes to resell for more money.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 38-year-old married woman who has run a business selling milk with her husband for the past five years. She has one cow, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit.  

Shamim has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Shamim is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 37-year-old married woman and mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Razia’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for two years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Razia has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 for her husband to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. Razia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Zeenat is a 37-year-old married woman who has been operating a crockery sales business for six months. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls, etc. Her husband also assists her in selling crockery to the people of their community and in the local market. She makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family's income. For the improvement of her business, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. This will allow her to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 41-year-old Aminata from Waterloo, Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children, ages 7 to 20 years old. In 2007, Aminata established her food stock business. She began her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income to support her home. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and onions to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and onions to expand her business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 33-year-old Zainab from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 5 years and 17 years old. Two of her children attend school. She started business to earn her daily survival for her family.
 
Zainab runs a food stand business; she sells onions and cooking seasonings; she has been running this business since 2011.   Zainab says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Zainab has requested a loan in order to buy foods like cooking seasonings, oil and onions. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy foods like cooking seasonings, oil and onions.

loans.name: Wajibu Group

texts.en:
Baraka, who is in his late 20s, is married with a child who is still young. For three years now,Baraka has had a barbershop business. He works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This is Baraka's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania which he will use to put in an aluminum door and air conditioning in his business premises. He is making these improvements in order to attract more people to his barbershop. Baraka  dreams that one day he will be able to improve his shop further and build a nice house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group" WAJIBU" which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to put in an aluminium door and air conditioning in his business premises.

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en:
Rosemary, who is in her early 40s, is a widow with three children, a boy and two girls. All of her children are in school. For five years now she has had a grocery business selling beer, soft drinks and spirits. She works from 4pm to mid-night daily, but sometimes to 3am, and is able to win a good return per month. 

This is her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to purchase more drinks. Rosemary dreams that one day she will be able to build her family a house. She will share this loan with her loan group "Hope Group" which consists of 5 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina nació en la ciudad de Sicuani pero vive  junto con su familia en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella tiene 30 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de ropa como por ejemplo chompas, pantalones, camisas, casacas, blusas, polos y otros cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar casacas y chompas pues se está acercando la temporada de lluvias, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Albina was born in Sicuani, but is living now together with her family in the city of Paucartambo. She is 30 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. Albina is a hardworking and enterprising woman that is getting ahead with her family thanks to her hard work.

Her main economic activity is selling clothes such as sweaters, pants, shirts, jackets, blouses and t-shirts. She is a responsible person and this is why she was invited to join the communal bank “Señor de Coyllority”. She is requesting a loan to buy jackets and sweaters, thinking of the rainy season that is approaching. Albina appreciates this loan and promises to pay the monthly installments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy jackets and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Aminata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children aged 2 years and 7 years old.  In 2007, Aminata established her food stand business. She began her business because she was a housewife but she wanted to create her own source of income to contribute in taking care of the children.  She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business  are price inflation and high cost of transportation.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasonings, and coconut oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and coconut oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Lucy from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children aged 3 years and 10 years old.  She began her business because she wanted to create her own source of income, instead of depending on her husband. In 2011, Lucy established her food stall.  She works at the business 9 hours per day, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Lucy requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, soft drinks and Pure Water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and buy a piece of land. In the future, Lucy plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, soft drinks and Pure Water.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 7 years and 20 years old. Her children attend school. She started business to earn her daily survival income for her family.
 
Fatmata runs a cooked food business. She sells cooked food at her house, and she has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business from 4:30 am, and she will not rest until the food is finished.   Fatmata says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy food ingredients like cooking seasoning, oil and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and develop her cooked food stand. In the future, she plans to have a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food like cooking seasonings, oil and rice

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Adama from Waterloo in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children, from age 7 to 20 years.  In 2005, Adama established her palm oil business. She began her business because she generates her own source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Adama plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mamusu from Waterloo in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 5 children from age 3 years to 22 years. In 2003, Mamusu established her food stock business. She began her business because she was a housewife but she wanted to create her own source of income to contribute to taking care of the children. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the high cost of transportation.

Mamusu requires a loan in order to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and coconut oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Mamusu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking seasonings and coconut oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Agnes                     Baby

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Agnes from Tombo in the western rural area of Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 years and 18 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Agnes established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Agnes requires a loan in order to buy gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future; Agnes plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Kadie is 45 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 9 years and 20 years. She runs a domestic products business in Tombo in the Western rural area in Sierra Leone. Two of her children are going to school.

She's been in this business since 2005 and sells flasks, rubber bowls and a variety of food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is her improper business location.

Kadie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more flasks, rubber bowls and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy purchase more flasks, rubber bowls and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Isatu from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 6 children between the ages of 8 years and 27 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Isatu runs a cookery business at home. She sells cooking items at her house. She has been running this business since 2007. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Isatu from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 5 children. Two of her children are going to school. After the war, Isatu established her baby clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. In the future Isatu plans to own a big baby clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Marie from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children. Three of her children are going to school. In 2003, Marie established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Marie requires a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business In the future. Marie plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is 35 years old and married with two children, 10 years and 17 years old. She runs a domestic products business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. Her children are going to school

She's been in this business since 2005 and sells a variety of food containers in her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is having no proper business location.

Mabinty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more home products and a variety of food container for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her expand her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more home products and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 36 años es una mujer amable. Está casada con Yimi y ambos tienen 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada. Elizabeth se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cerdos, cuyes y vacas; los que engorda para luego venderlos a un precio mayor en las ferias que se realiza en la ciudad más cercana a su localidad, pero de las vacas obtiene leche pura todo los días, la cual comercializa a una empresa que elabora leche embasada y de la que recibe un ingreso económico adicional. Ahora desea expandir su negocio y tener mejores ganancias, pues desea brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Elizabeth, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de comida balanceada al por mayor para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old and a friendly woman. She is married to a man named Yimi and they have to children with whom they live in a rented home. Elizabeth makes a living raising animals like chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and cows. She fattens these animals up to then sell at a better price in the open air markets held in the nearby city. She also milks the cows every day to sell to a milk packaging plant, receiving an additional income. 

She now wishes to expand her business and have greater earnings. She hopes to bring her family a better quality of life. This is her second loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives in order to get ahead. She is committed to paying her loans on time. She will invest 1500 soles in the purchase of wholesale animal feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Mercedes Victoria

texts.es: Mercedes de 38  de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja como empleado en una fábrica y sus dos  hijos menores de edad  los cuales estudian actualmente, Doña Mercedes posee un taller de costura desde hace 3 años ella se dedica a su negocio durante la semana es una persona emprendedora y dedicada a sus labores además es muy amable con sus clientes, posee una gran clientela ya establecida, con la ganancia que obtiene y la ayuda de esposo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Mercedes solicita un crédito para invertir en telas, botones, agujas, zippers, además compra de maquinaria para poder producir más, y no solo depender de los pedidos semanales que le hacen sus clientes ya fijos,  y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Thirty eight year-old Mercedes lives in the house that she owns with her husband and two young children. Her husband works in a factory and her children currently attend school.  

For three years now, Mercedes has had a sewing workshop where she works during the week. She has an entrepreneurial spirit and is dedicated to her work. She is also very amiable with her customers. She already has a large clientele. With her earnings and the help of her husband, she manages to cover some of her household expenses. 

Mercedes is requesting a loan to purchase fabric, buttons, needles, zippers, as well as machinery to be able to produce more, and no longer rely solely on the weekly orders that her regular customers make. This will enable her to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, buttons, needles, zippers etc. as well as machinery.

loans.name: Santa Celina

texts.es: Doña Santa de 49 años vive en casa alquilada con su esposo y  sus dos  hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, es una persona responsable, emprendedora además es muy amable con sus clientes y su mercadería la vende rápidamente por su buena calidad y precios accesibles. Doña Santa solicita un crédito para comprar ropa y zapatos por mayor para poder incrementar sus ganancias y así poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Santa is 49 years old and lives in a rented home with her husband and two children. She makes a living selling clothing and shoes traveling on foot through several communities near her home, which she has done for ten years. She is a responsible and entrepreneurial woman and is also very friendly with her customers. She sells her products quickly because of the high quality and affordable prices. 

Santa is requesting a loan to buy wholesale clothing and shoes in order to increase her earnings and in this way offer greater economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children who attend school. Her husband is unemployed at this stage. This is really a bad issue since Fatmeh is the only one who is taking care of the family financial-wise. She works as a tailor, a business that barely earns her enough revenue. She states that living costs are becoming very expensive. This is the reason why she is in real need today of borrowing a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, which funds will be paid at once to cover her children’s tutoring fees. Fatmeh’s simple demand is to insure a good educational level to her children and guarantee that they will engage in good positions in their professional careers.

loans.use: to cover her children’s tutoring fees.

loans.name: Uzima Group

texts.fr:
Chantal fait partie du groupe Uzima et   habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 49 ans et est mariée à Ibrahim, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés de  8 à 32 ans, tous étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de restaurant et des habits  depuis 12 ans. 

Elle  est à son  quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits, de kilos de haricot,  de riz, à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années à venir, elle voudrait  faire le commerce d’importation des produits de la Tanzanie ou de l' Ouganda et voir les enfants terminer les études.
texts.en: Chantal is a part of the Uzima group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 49-years-old and is married to Ibrahim, a driver. Together, they have three children, between the ages of 8 and 32, all studying. She has run a restaurant and clothing business for 12 years. She is on her fourth loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan that she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing and kilos of beans and rice to resell in order to gain more money. In the years to come, she would like to run a product importation business from Tanzania or from Uganda and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing and kilos of beans and rice to resell to get more profit.

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Viviane est trésorière du collectif  d’affaire  « Alliance», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 32 ans et mère de 2 enfants  qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un cultivateur. La cliente est vendeuse d’unités d’appel. Elle installe son point de vente au long de la rue, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de  son mari,  il y a environ 8 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 200000 unités d’appel. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une jolie maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The customer, Viviane, is treasurer of the "Alliance" business group. She is a young entrepreneur who is 32 years old and mother to two children, who are both at school. Her husband is a farmer. The customer sells mobile telephone credits. She sells them along the road and sometimes from home. She began her business with capital she received from her husband around eight years ago. This new loan will enable her to buy 200,000 telephone credit units. She would like to expand her business as well as to educate and feed her children and build a pretty house. Finally she is extremely grateful to Hekima for its support in the form of micro-loans to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 200,000 telephone credits units.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.fr:
Salum fait partie du groupe  Grâce et   habite à Bujumbura. Il a 56 ans et est marié à Françoise, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés de  18 à 31 ans, dont 4 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge son petit fils.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz, sel savon,…) depuis 4 ans. 

Il est à son  troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, sel, savon,…), à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années , il voudrait remettre en activité son véhicule, et voir ses enfants diplômés.
texts.en:
Salum belongs to the Grâce group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 56 years old and married to Françoise, who is a trader. They have five children together, whose ages range from 18 to 31 years old; four of the children are studying. He takes care of his grandchild.

He has been selling products in a shop (rice, salt, soap) for the past four years, and is on his third loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan that he is granted, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of products for his shop (rice, salt, soap) that he will resell in order to make more money.

In the coming years he would like to get his vehicle going again and see his children graduate from school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of products for his shop (rice, salt, soap), which he will resell to earn more money.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: María Antonieta nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive  junto con su familia en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de pasajes de transporte inter provincial de la ruta Paucartambo a Cusco, entonces ella y algunas de sus hijas van abrir una tienda de venta de regalos y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar regalos como por ejemplo perfumes, libros, colonias, aretes, peluches y otras cosas más,  ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
María Antonieta was born in the city of Paucartambo and lives with her family in the same city. She is 37 years old and is in a civil union from which she has give children. She is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman who gets her family ahead with the effort she puts into her work. Her main economic activity is the sale of inter-provincial bus tickets from Paucartambo to Cusco. 

She and her daughters are now going to open a gift store. At this time she needs a loan to buy gifts including perfumes, colognes, books, earrings, stuffed animals, and more. She is thankful and appreciative of the loan and is committed to paying her monthly loan installments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy gifts including perfumes, colognes, books, earrings, stuffed animals and other items.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
35-year-old Oretha from Liberia lives in Paynesville south area. She calls herself a businesswoman because she is business-minded. She stopped school in the 10th grade. She and her fiancé are living together; they have a twenty-year-old child who is attending some college.

Oretha has a shop where she is selling goods such as soap, rice, toothpaste, sardines, oil, razor blades, batteries, drinks, etc. Presently she is not facing much problem in her business, except thinking of increasing her sales,  She has her shop open from 7 am to 10 pm every day. She uses a taxi most of the time to bring her goods to her shop,   

Oretha established this business by running a waiter market with little money from from her mother, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She enjoys the buying of her customers and she is proud because her business is expanding every day. She intends to buy additional goods like those mentioned above to increase her sales. Her future plans are to build a house and continue to send her only child to college. She would like to say thanks to those who lend to BRAC Liberia businesses, because it is through them BRAC Liberia lends people like her money, so they are able to stand on their own feet.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like soap, rice, toothpaste, sardines, oil, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 28 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number-one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and has four children aged between 8 months and 13 years; only the three oldest ones attend school, and they all live at home. Unfortunately, she stopped her education in 3rd grade, but she manages her business well. 

She has been operating a shop where she sells charcoal from 2007 up to the present. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money. She sells six days in a week, from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., and most of the time, she uses a bus to get her charcoal to her shop. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Enphemia J.

texts.en:
Enphemia J. is 49 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number-one commercial county in Liberia. She is single and has five children aged between 19 and 30; only one lives at home and attends school.

She is a high school graduate, and she described herself as a very hardworking woman. For the past five years, she has been operating a table from which she sells rice, charcoal, oil, etc., around  the local market. She started this business with money from savings. She enjoys her business because she gets money to help other relatives sometimes. She sells six days in a week, from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. A taxi is her favorite car she likes to use when it is needed. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventories such as rice, charcoal, oil. etc., for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories such as rice, charcoal, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 39 years old and lives in the Gardabani district with her husband and child. She’s unemployed at the moment. The only source of income for the family is the unstable income earned by Elmira’s husband who works as a construction assistant from time to time. As their existing income is very small and not enough to cover everyday expenses, Elmira decided to start up a clothing sales business. However, local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Elmira’s credit requests have been rejected several times as she didn’t satisfy their requirements. 

Elmira is requesting a 1,100 USD loan to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and resell it in the local market and from her house to her neighbors. Her loan is within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program, that gives vulnerable poor the chance to start or re-start businesses. Elmira plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women, and children. It is obvious that her job is hard for Elmira, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family and their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing at wholesale prices to resell in the local market

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 31 years old and married with three children, ages four, five, and six. He lives with his family. His family does not have a source of income at the moment, as Ramin has recently returned from abroad, where he lived and worked. Ramin plans to start up a café. Local credit providers have rejected his loan request because of his low income and lack of experience in the café business. 

Ramin is requesting a loan to purchase needed inventory, kitchen appliances, and products to start a café. His loan application was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions to vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. According to Ramin’s estimations, his project will be profitable and he will attract many customers. As a result of his new business initiative, his family's income will increase and their living conditions will improve. In addition to the above, his family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to start a cafe

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Isatu from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 2 children, ages 3 years and 6 years.  

Isatu runs a tea and cooking food shop at home. She sells cooking food and tea. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Isatu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, milk and coffee. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, milk and coffee.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Zainab from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is single with 2 children. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2010, Zainab established her home products business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy more of a variety of sets of pans for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her children's welfare. In the future Zainab plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more of a variety of sets of pans for resale.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Jenneh from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 5 and 12 years. Two children are currently attending school. In 2010, Jenneh established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Jenneh requires a loan in order to buy gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future Jenneh plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children, ages 10 years and 15 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Kadiatu established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future Kadiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 30 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number-one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with a 5-year-old child who is attending school and lives at home. She was fortunate to complete 12th grade, and she manages her business well. She described herself as a good businesswoman. 

For the past four years, she has been selling soft drinks in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her child's father, who is a driver. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money to sustain herself and her child. She sells from Monday to Saturday for four hours. Most of the time, she uses a bus to get her goods to her table that she sells from. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her plans are to build a house, to educate her child and get married in the near future. She thanks BRAC Liberia for connecting borrowers and the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Tracy from Liberia. She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rent and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live.
 
Tracy is single, with four children, between the ages of 5 and 11. All of her children attend school and live with her at home. She runs a table business selling doughnuts. 

Tracy describes herself as serious businesswoman. She started her business five years ago, using money from her susu (local saving). Typically, Tracy works from 7am to 3pm, Monday to Saturday. She transports goods to her business by bus. 

Tracy cites her greatest challenge as a small amount of capital. She is proud of her business because it helps her to support her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, Tracy intends to purchase oil, sugar, flour etc. In the future, she plans to build a house and educate her children. Tracy sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar and flour etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Please meet 34-year-old Lydia from Paynesville South Area, Liberia. She is single with a seven-year-old child who lives with her and attends school. Paynesville South is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  It is one of the areas in Montserrado County with the highest population and best standards of living.  There are good roads, access to water, affordable rents and many transportation options in the area.  For the past five years, Lydia has owned and operated a restaurant. She learned the business by selling for her mother and describes herself as serious woman. Lydia's major business challenges are customer complaints and the high price of food. Her favorite part of her business is the profit that she makes.

Lydia is requesting a loan to buy a bag of rice, pepper, oil, dried fish, and other items for her restaurant. In the future, she hopes to own a house.  Lydia is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, oil, dried fish, and other items

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Mombasa, Kenya, where she sells vegetables and fruits. Her business has been in operation for more than two years now and it has been productive enough that she was able to employ someone to help her run it. She has some formal employment which earns her extra income so that she does not entirely depend on the business. She is 26 years old, married and blessed with three children. The challenge she faces in the business is high transportation costs and weather uncertainties. 

She heard of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes to sell. The extra income that she raises from the business will pay her children's school fees and also help her open more branches of her business. Her living standards will also improve as a result of the income.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Sallay

texts.en:
Sallay is 35 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 2 years and 9 years. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo in the Western rural area in Sierra Leone. Two of her children are going to school.

She's been in this business since 2005 and sells spoons, rubber bowls and variety of food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is her improper business location.

Sallay requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more spoons, rubber bowls and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more spoons, rubber bowls and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Mary from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 3 children between the ages of 7 years and 15 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Mary runs a cookery business at home. She sells cooked food at her house. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Mary says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Mary has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Fatu from Tombo in the Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 3 children between the ages of 4 years and 16 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Fatu runs a cookery business at home; she sells cooked food at her house. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Fatu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Fatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is in her early 40s and widowed with 2 children, ages 3 years and 18 years. She runs a domestic product sales business in Tombo in the Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since after the rebel war and sells a variety of food containers within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is her improper business location.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plates and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her status of living. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plates and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 25 years old and married with two children. She runs a domestic products business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since 2005 and sells a variety of food containers  in her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is not having a  business location.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plates and a variety of food container for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plates and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seedlings and hire labour.

loans.name: Buana

texts.en:
Balinese artisan, Buana, specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of natural gemstones and silver to prepare new designs and increase his stock.

Buana has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"I've been surrounded by handicrafts all my life. I am thankful to God for giving me such a great gift, so I can make a living for my family. Not much, perhaps, but enough for our simple way of life.

"This microcredit will go towards purchasing the materials I need. My deepest gratitude to all of you, for your support and for making this microcredit happen. Thanks!"

Use the link below to view Buana's handmade jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5503

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of natural gemstones and silver to prepare new designs and increase his stock.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee, de 41 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a su esposo Elmer y sus 2 hijos en la casa que compró hace 20 años. Su día se centra en el cuidado de sus animales, posee 4 vacas lecheras de buena raza, las cuales cuida con mucho esmero pues depende mucho de la alimentación del día, la cantidad de leche que brindará, según menciona extrae un promedio de 20 litros de leche diarios que comercializa a los distribuidores de la zona. Como es una mujer del campo comparte su tiempo con la agricultura, sembrando maíz y papa en sus terrenos agrícolas, de donde obtiene alimentos para su consumo y si siembra en cantidad, comercializa las cosechas en su mismo terreno o en ocasiones al mercado mayorista de la ciudad más cercana. Ahora ella desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos, cuidado la calidad de sus sembríos y animales. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Aydee, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Aydee, 41, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband Elmer and two children in a house she bought twenty years ago. Her daily activity is to take care of her animals; she has four milk cows of a good breed, and she takes good care of them since the quality and quantity of the milk depends heavily on what they eat. She says that she milks twenty liters on average every day, to be sold to local distributors. Since she is a countrywoman, she spends her time working in agriculture, growing corn and potatoes in her lands. She feeds her family and if there is any left, she sells her produce on-site or sometimes in the wholesale market of the closest city.

She now wants to improve her income and preserve the quality of her crops and animals. This is her second loan with Kiva and she appreciates this financial support, which helps her to get ahead. She promises to pay the installments on time. Aydee will use the 500 soles [PEN] to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 44 years old and divorced with two children. She lives in the town of Kutaisi and works as a nurse at the diagnostic center where she gets a small monthly salary of approximately 145 USD. Lia is the only one earning money in her household, as her children are underage. She wanted to start a clothing business but she found that she didn’t have enough saving to do so. 

Lia is requesting a loan from MFO Credo to purchase wholesale clothing to sell in her community with a price markup. Her customers will be her coworkers and neighbors. Lia's application was approved under the framework of the Startup Program, which enables vulnerable poor people to have the chance to start or restart businesses. Lia hopes that her business will be profitable and her family will have additional income to cover food and everyday expenses. Lia awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a clothing business

loans.name: Rakhib

texts.en:
Rakhib is a 56-year-old farmer from the village of Kachagani, Marneuli district. He is married and lives with his wife Egana. 

Rakhib has been involved in the agricultural industry since early childhood. His parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. Rakhib works hard on family-owned agricultural land. He cultivates the land and sows different kinds of vegetables. In addition, Rakhib has apple and persimmon trees. 

Rakhib always has high quality products, which he sells to local retailers for a good price. Despite working hard, the existing income is not enough to cover food and every day expenses for Rakhib's family. As a result, Rakhib decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions but his attempts were unsuccessful because of the economic conditions. 

The startup program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables vulnerable, poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Rakhib's application for a loan of 2000 GEL to open a small café was approved under the framework of this program. 

Rakhib needs to purchase tables and chairs for his café. After the equipment is purchased, he will be able to open the café and generate a stable income. 

Rakhib will work hard to satisfy his clients' requirements.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and open a café.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from Voskehat village, where she lives with her in-laws, husband, and three school-aged children. Her family has been involved in agriculture for many years and owns a plot of land where they cultivate potato, wheat, and greens. The family also grows apple and pear trees and they sell the harvest locally. Mariam's husband went to a neighboring country to find a good job and support his family financially. So, now agriculture is their only income source to help cover the family's daily costs.  Mariam is a very hardworking farmer with a good credit history.

Mariam is requesting a loan to purchase three pigs, four calves, and fertilizer. She plans to become involved with livestock and expand her farming business. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her family to enlarge their business and income.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs, four calves, and fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Doña Ana vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, desde hace varios años posee un taller de estructura metálicas fabrica balcones, puertas, ventanas etc. ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues aunque es mujer realiza un muy buen trabajo también su hijo le ayuda en el negocio,  con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales que utiliza en su taller de estructuras metálicas como: hierro, pintura, laminas, herramientas etc. y así seguir con su negocio y  poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own house with her life partner and her son. For many years now she has had a metal fabrication workshop in her home making items such as balconies, doors, windows etc. She has a lot of customers since although she is a woman she does very good work. Her son helps her in the business and with the profits she makes Ana is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Ana is asking for a loan to buy the materials she uses in the workshop to make metal structures, such as iron, paint, sheet metal, tools etc. so she can continue with her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy iron, paint, sheet metal, tools etc.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
You are most welcome to meet Stephanie from Liberia. She is a widow, 54 years old, and she has five children who live at home. Only three of her children are in school. Her oldest child's age is 21 and the last child is age 10.  

Stephanie has been operating a local restaurant in order to pay for her children's schooling. In order to maintain her home happily, she explains, she is going to buy additional bags of rice and more oil since these two items are most useful for preparing her food. Stephanie uses a share taxi all the time to transport her goods to her restaurant. 

She began her business right after her high school days with a little amount of money that she gathered from her parents. She is happy with her business because it is the only source of income generating money to sustain her family. All her dreams and hopes are to one day be an owner of a big store, and see all her children out of university.  She congratulates BRAC Liberia for their partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice and more oil since these two items are most useful for preparing her food.

loans.name: Chelsea

texts.en:
Kindly meet Chelsea from Liberia who is single and has five children with ages ranging from 16 to 2. Chelsea attended grade school and stopped her studies in the 7th grade. Two of her children are staying with their father and three are staying with her at home. She stated that she is aware that the two children with their father are in school. Among the three who live with her, only two are attending school, while the young one stays at home with her. 

Chelsea explained how she has been going to the wholesale center to buy cassava, coconut and peanuts by the bag to resell. She sells from 8am to 5pm Monday to Saturday. She uses a bike to lug her goods from the village to the main road and uses a taxi from the main road to the city of Paynesville south, in Monrovia, Liberia. 

She started this business by selling corn from the roadside with a little money from her mother, who taught her how to do this out-of-town-business. Chelsea expressed how she loves the buying, and she is proud of her business because she believes God directs more customers to her business every day, and that can cause her goods to be sold quicker. 

She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. Also she hopes that her children will have a bright future, as she is trying her best to educate them. She gives thanks to the lenders of Kiva for supporting the program and empowering small business people. God should bless them.

loans.use: to buy cassava, coconut and peanuts by the bag to resell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
