Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de  son mari,  il y a environ 10 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 bidons d’huile et 1 sac de farine manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et construire une belle maison. L’insuffisance du capital constitue un défi pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Sofia, the customer, is an advisor to the "Karibu" business group. A dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, she is 45 years old and the mother of 9 children who all attend school. Her spouse is a fisherman (and shipowner).

Sofia sells oil and cassava flour. She offers her products to customers at the market and, occasionally, at home. She started her business about 10 years ago with her own funds, received from her husband. This new loan will be used to buy 2 cans of oil and a bag of cassava flour. She would like to increase her business, to feed her children and ensure they get an education, and to build a nice house. The lack of sufficient capital is the main challenge to the growth of her business. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs in the form of microloans.

loans.use: to buy 2 cans of oil and 1 bag of cassava flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Cinyabugu est conseillère du collectif  d’affaire  « Asifiwe», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 7 enfants  qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’administration publique. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers. Elle installe ses articles au marché, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima,  il y a environ 3 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 15 paires de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. L’insuffisance du capital constitue un défi pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Cinyabugu, the customer, is an advisor to the "Asifiwe" business group. A young and experienced entrepreneur, she is 36 years old and the mother of 7 children who all attend school. Her spouse is a civil servant.

Cinyabugu sells shoes. She offers her products to customers at the market and, occasionally, at home. She started her business about 3 years ago with a loan she received from the MFI Hekima. This new loan will be used to buy 15 pairs of shoes. She would like to increase her business and to feed her children and ensure they get an education. Her lack of sufficient capital is a challenge to the development of her business. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs in the form of microloans.

Note: one of the customers in the photo is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ineza Ii Group

texts.fr:
Daniel fait partie du groupe  InezaII et   habite à Bujumbura. Il a 42 ans et est marié à Suzanne. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de  1 à 13  ans, dont 2 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge son frère.

Il est menuisier et fait le commerce de produits en bois (tables, chaise, lit,…) depuis 4 ans. 

Il est à son  quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de planches pour la fabrication de tables,  de chaises,… à vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années , il voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Daniel is a member of the Ineza II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 42 years old and married to Suzanne. The couple have 4 children aged between 1 and 13 years old, 2 of whom attend school. He is also taking care of his brother.

Daniel is a carpenter and has been selling products made out of wood (tables, chairs, beds, etc.) for 4 years. This is his 4th loan from Turame. His Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his capital and allow him to buy a lot of wooden boards with which to make items like tables and chairs, which he will then resell so that he can earn more money. In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land and see his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy a lot of boards with which to make tables, chairs, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Hermann Jeannot

texts.fr: Hermann est un jeune homme dede 32 ans.il a  opté faire dans la vente des beignets dans un marché de la place.au regard de mla petitesse de son capital,ilse trouve confronté à un problème de rupture de stock et ses clients szeb trouvesnt insatisfaits. raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter de la faine en grande quantité afin d'(accroitre son offre. cei lui permettra de réaliser les bénéfices.lesquels lui permettront enretour de réaliser ses projets à savoir s'acheter à long terme des pousses qui puissent lui permettre dedistribuer facilement ses beignets dans toute a ville.de même,il aimerait créer une bonne activité pour fonder une famille.
texts.en: Hermann is a young man who is 32 years old. He made the choice to sell fritters in a local market, but because he has very little capital he is confronted with a shortage of stock and cannot satisfy customer demand. For this reason he is requesting a loan so that he can buy a large quantity of flour and increase supply. This will enable him to make money and thereby achieve his objectives which are in the long term to buy rickshaws which will enable to distribute his fritters all over town. He would like to develop a good business to be able to start a family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of flour.

loans.name: Messina

texts.fr: MESSINA est une femme mariée de 52 ans mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge du  jeune est de 22 ans. elle fait dans la vente de bananes plantains depuis 04 ans.compte tenu de la petitesse de son capital,elle est constamment confrontée à un problème de rupture de stocks de bananes plantains. raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter le stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. les bénéfices qui en résulteront  lui permettront d'étendre son activité .de même,elle compte sur cette activité pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille notamment l'éducation de senfants et petits enfants.
texts.en:
Messina is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of three children, of whom the youngest is aged 22. 

Messina has been selling plantain bananas for the past four years. Given her lack of capital, she is constantly confronted with the problem of gaps in her stock. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to increase her stock in order to satisfy her customers.

Earnings will allow her to expand her business. She also counts on this business to support the needs of her family, especially the schooling of her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas

loans.name: Christine Josyane

texts.fr: Christine est une femme 49 ans mère d'un enfant âgé de 13 ans. elle fait dans la production artisanale  depuis 21 ans.compte tenu de la petitesse de son capital,elle est constamment confrontée à un problème de manque de matériels. raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter les matières premières telles: le bois,du contre-plaquet nécessaire pour la confection de ses objets d'arts. les bénéfices qui en résulteront  lui permettront de réinvestir en en augmentant la production et étendre les ventes sur les grandes surfaces.de même,elle compte sur cette activité pour pouvoir mettre sur pied un atélier de production.
texts.en:
Christine is 49 years old and a mother of a 13-year-old. She has been producing artisanal goods for 21 years. 

Given her small pool of capital, she constantly lacks materials. For this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy raw materials, like wood and plywood, which she needs to make her art.

Earnings will allow her to reinvest in her business, leading to an increase in production and an expansion of sales to large stores.

She is counting on this business so that she can set up her own workshop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Abizera Group

texts.fr:
Acqueline fait partie du groupe Abizera  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée  à Déo, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 6 à 12 dont 2 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce  du riz, du haricot, …dans sa boutique depuis 12ans. 

Elle  est cliente de  Turame depuis 3 ans. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique ( riz, haricot,…)à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les  prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  avoir un deuxième point de vente.
texts.en:
Acquiline is a member of the Abizera group and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and is marred to Deo, a merchant. Together they have four children, aged from 6 to 12 years old. Two of the children go to school. 

Acquiline has been selling rice, beans, etc. in her shop for 12 years. She has been with Turame for three years. With this Kiva-backed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a number of goods for her store (rice, beans...) to resell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to open a second store.

loans.use: to buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Alma has been in this business for 5 years. Alma earns more income from pig fattening and farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses that she is engaged in.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He owns a motorbike that transports people in town over short distances. He has employed someone to do the job for him. He has some formal employment which makes him busy. He has been in this business for two years and counting. He is 34 years old and married with three children. Two of his children attend school.

He wants to own a public service vehicle in the future. He heard of Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy another motorbike. The major challenge in the business is the high cost of fuel that he has to incur for the motorbike to run. The extra income that he raises will go towards paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Gilma De Jesús

texts.es:
Doña Gilma de Jesús es una señora de 38 años, madre soltera de tres hijos dos de ellos estudiando actualmente, habita en la comarca Las Pilas ubicada a 10 km del municipio de El Sauce.
Se dedica al pequeño comercio donde su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa nueva para damas y caballeros donde tiene 20 de dedicarse a este negocio.
Camina de manera ambulante a pie recorriendo las comarcas de las Pilas y La Palma casa por casa ofreciendo sus productos.
Doña Gilma tiene gran demanda de ropa por la variedad que ofrece y los precios bajos accesibles al cliente.
Necesita de más capital para invertir en nueva variedad de ropa que sus clientes le están demandando, por tal razón está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel con fondos de los inversionistas de Kiva con el cual pretende comprar pantalones, blusas, zapatos, ropa interior y camisas de varón.
Tiene la esperanza que estas personas de buen corazón aprueben su solicitud para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que es lo más importante para ella tenerlos satisfechos y contentos.
texts.en:
Gilma de Jesús is thirty eight years old. She is the single mother of three children, two of whom are currently in school. She lives in the district of Las Pilas, located 10 km from the municipality of El Sauce. 

For the past twenty years she has had a small business which consists of selling new clothes for men and women. She travels by foot around the neighbourhoods of Las Pilas and La Palma, offering her products house-by-house. There is a high demand for the clothes because Gilma offers a good variety and affordable prices. 

She requires more capital to invest in the new styles of clothes that her clients are requesting. This is why she is asking for a loan from Ceprodel with the funds from Kiva lenders. She will use it to buy pants, blouses, shoes, underwear and men's shirts. 

She hopes these goodhearted people approve her request so that she can satisfy her customers' demands. The most important thing for her is to have happy and satisfied customers.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shoes, underwear and men's shirts.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat is 52 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a mechanic. Saodat has worked at the Department of Social Protection Employment for more than 21 years. She is hardworking and that’s what makes her job very good. Her colleagues know her as a smart and kind woman. 

Her children are Daler, Dildora, Nigora and Dilshod. Her son graduated from school and entered the Technical University of Tajikistan. He entered at the faculty of business and management. Her son is clever. Saodat hopes that, in the future, her son will be a good specialist.

She must pay for her son’s education at the university, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan to pay the education tuition of her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education at the university

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 41 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adela has been farming vegetables for 3 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for five years.

Josephine requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional stock of dry goods to sell.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a 48-year-old married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Bibiana has been engaged in the buying and selling of bananas for several years now; this is the source of her income. 

Bibiana is asking for a loan to buy more bananas to sell. With this, she will be able to have more bananas to sell to the market. 

In the future, Bibiana hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is 60 years old. He is married, and lives with his wife and mother in the small village of Chokhatauri district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension.  As his wife has health problems, she gets small monthly pension from government institutions, which is hardly enough for medicines. 

Shota is actively involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, he has two milk cows and a calf. In addition, he has a plot of agricultural land, where maize and nut trees are grown. He cultivates the land and does all the agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold at local markets. 

As the existing income is not enough for the family, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Shota applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of 2,000 GEL will help Shota start his own business. He plans to purchase nuts, and then sell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of his family and increase his stablity. 

With the support of the Start Up program, Shota will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of nuts to sell

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 31 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines; she has been doing this for two years.  She earns additional income from a general store.  Lucresia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam sells second-hand clothes in the local market in Mombasa city, where she also resides. She is 45 years old, married, and blessed with two teenage children. Both of them attend school.  

Mariam has been in the business for more than ten years. At the shop where she does her business, she also sells cosmetics and operates a salon. She has ambitions of diversifying her earnings more, and making sure that she is stable. 

She does not face major challenges in the business now. She learned of Milango through a friend who invited her to join. 

She now seeks a loan to buy bed sheets, bedcovers, and pillowcases for sale. The extra income that she raises will help her pay school fees for her children, and to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, bedcovers, and pillowcases to sell

loans.name: Karem Xiomara

texts.es:
Karem Xiomara es una joven de 25 años de edad, madre de dos niños uno de ellos en edad escolar, habita en el municipio de El sauce donde nació y creció.
Estudió la carrera de magisterio y desde muy joven a la edad de 17 años inició a laborar como profesora de primaria en una comarca ubicada a 17 km de dicho municipio donde tiene que recorrer en bicicleta desde muy temprano para estar puntual en su centro de estudios.
A pesar de ser tan joven ella y su esposo son personas responsables que han enfrentado muchas adversidades como que por la falta de empleo en Nicaragua su esposo tuvo que emigrar hacia Costa Rica en busca de trabajo y ayudar a su señora con los gastos del hogar.
Hoy en la actualidad se encuentra con la dificultad que su niño está mal de salud por lo que se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel en busca de un crédito con fondos Kiva con el cual comprará medicamentos y pagará consultas médicas.
Tiene la fe en Dios que con la ayuda de este financiamiento mejorará la salud de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Karem Xiomara is 25 years old and a mother to two children, one of whom is in school.  Karem lives in the town of El Sauce, where she was born and raised.

Karem studied education and, from the young age of 17, she started working as a primary teacher in an area 17km from her home. To get to work she has to cycle early every morning, so that she arrives at school on time.

In spite of being so young, Karem and her husband are responsible people who have faced many problems, such as the lack of jobs in Nicaragua.  Karem's husband had to emigrate to Costa Rica to look for work and to help his wife with household costs.

Today Karem's problem is that her son is in bad health.  So, she has come to Ceprodel to apply for a loan from Kiva.  She will use this loan to buy medication and to pay for doctors' appointments.

Karem has faith in God that, with the help of this loan, her son's health will improve.

loans.use: to buy medication and to pay for doctors' appointments.

loans.name: María De La Concepción

texts.es:
María , es una señora ejemplar de profesión maestra de educación Secundaria, actualmente esta jubilada, pero ejerce un negocio de venta de visuteria, es casada.
Actualmente presenta una necesidad de pagar los módulos de graduación a uno de sus hijos que estudia Arquitectura en una universidad de la ciudad, por eso se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para realizar el pago de módulos de Arquitectura, de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida. Y agradeciéndole a ceprodel por el crédito oportuno y por el apoyo para lograr su sueño.
texts.en:
María is an exemplary secondary school teacher.  She is currently retired but she has a small business selling costume jewellery.  She is married.

María needs to pay for one of her son's graduating modules in architecture at one of the city's universities.  So, she has come to the Ceprodel offices to apply for a loan to pay for the modules.  With this loan she can improve her living conditions and quality of life.  María is grateful to Ceprodel for this loan and for the support in achieving her dream.

loans.use: to pay for graduating modules in architecture studies.

loans.name: Belkys Elena

texts.es:
Belkys, es una Joven señora, que trabaja en el ministerio de educación de la localidad, desempeñándose como responsable administrativa, con 3 años de experiencia en dicho cargo, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo a su cargo el  cual es menor de edad al que le brinda todo su apoyo económico y moral, esta señora vive con su familia en el mismo hogar, de profesión  Lic. Administración de Empresas., actualmente está presentando la necesidad de tramitar el titulo de  Maestra de educación primaria, , por eso se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para pagar los tramites de titulo de docente de primaria y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida y oportunidades de empleo.
Y agradeciéndole a ceprodel por el crédito oportuno y por el apoyo para lograr su sueño.
texts.en:
Belkys is a young woman, who works for the department for education in her local town.  She works as an administrative assistant, with three years experience in this position.  Belkys is a  single mother.  She has a son under her charge and she provides all him with all her financial and moral support.  Belkys lives with her family.  She has a degree in Business Administration.  She currently needs to pay for her Master's in primary education and so has come to the Ceprodel offices to apply for a loan.  The loan will pay for her studies and Belkys will be able to improve her quality of living and chances of being employed.

Belkys is grateful to Ceprodel for the loan and for the support in achieving her dream.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in primary education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her son's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her son's secondary school tuition.

loans.name: Ma. Cielo

texts.en:
Ma. Cielo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has pig-raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Ma. Cielo has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from her internet cafe.

Ma. Cielo has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, de 34 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Paulino, con quien tiene 4 hijos pero solo vive con 3 de ellos en la casa que compró hace 14 años. Paulina se dedica a la agricultura, su casa se encuentra rodeada de extensas áreas verdes, donde siembra papa y maíz en cantidad los cuales comercializa de manera constante, este actividad la incentivó a comenzar en la crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas en cantidad, en un inicio solo utilizaba a los animales para su consumo, pero con el tiempo su ganado aumentó es así que ahora es una de las actividades económicas que tiene, por lo que está pensando en utilizar una de los terrenos que posee para comenzar con la siembra de alfalfa, por lo que compró semillas de buena calidad para emprender este reto, el cual le ayudará a alimentar a los animales que posee y también a arrendar el pasto a los demás agricultores. Este es su segundo crédito con KIva, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Paulina, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para su siembra de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Paulina, 34 years old, is a modest woman.  She lives in the company of her husband Paulino with whom she has 4 children but she only lives with 3 of them in the house that she bought 14 years ago.  Paulina works in agriculture.  Her house is surrounded by extensive green areas, where she plants potatoes and corn in abundance which she sells steadily.  This activity encouraged her to begin raising animals like guinea pigs and chickens in quantity.  In the beginning she only used the animals for consumption but with time her livestock increased and it is is this way that now it is one of the economic activities that she has.  She is thinking about using one of the fields that she has to begin planting alfalfa, for which she bought good quality seeds to embark on this challenge which will help her to feed the animals that she has and also to rent out the pasture to other farmers.  

This is her second loan with Kiva.  She is grateful for the received financial support as it will allow her to improve her income and so she promises to be punctual with the payment of her installments. 

Paulina will invest the 500 soles (PEN) in the purchase of organic fertilizer for her alfalfa planting.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Evergista

texts.en:
Evergista is a 47-year-old farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children. Evergista helps her husband in tilling their farm.

Evergista is asking for a loan   to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve the productivity of the farm  thus improving their yield and income.  In the future, Evergista has hopes of expanding their farm so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es: La señora Efigenia es una mujer casada, mayor de edad, visionaria, su actividad económica  es un  pequeño comercio lo efectúa, en su  casa de habitación como es la venta de zapatos. Actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda por eso se decidió visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de cemento, perlin, lavandero y el pago de la mano de obra y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida en su seno familiar.
texts.en: Efigenia is an older, married woman.  She is a visionary whose economic activity is based around a small shoe business that she runs out of her home.  At the moment she is in need of improving her housing conditions which is why she decided to visit Ceprodel to solicit a loan to purchase cement, purlin and pay for cleaning and labor.  This will allow her to improve the conditions and quality of life of her family.

loans.use: purchase cement, purlin, and pay for cleaning and labor.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Razel is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Razel has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Razel requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Razel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Razel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Estelita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her sewing business. She has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Estelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Feye

texts.en:
Feye works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Feye requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Feye would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Saira

texts.en: Saira is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a general store in her community for the past twelve years. She offers various items and goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and a good client list. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items such as grains, sugar and salts to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She wishes to spend part of her profits to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items such as grains, sugar and salts.

loans.name: María  Evelyn

texts.es:
María , es una señora ejemplar de profesión Licenciada en Ciencias de la Educación, actualmente   como directora en un centro de la comunidad, con 27 años de experiencia en el ministerio de educación, 
Actualmente presenta una necesidad de mejorar su casa como es  el reforzamiento de techo el que está en mal estado, por eso se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para comprar materiales como zinc, perlines y pago de mano de obra, de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
Y agradeciéndole a ceprodel por el crédito oportuno y por el apoyo para lograr su sueño.
texts.en:
María is an exemplary woman with a professional license in Education.  Currently, she is the director of a community center, with 27 years of experience in the ministry of education.  

At the moment, she is in need of making repairs to her home.  She must reinforce her roof as it is in poor condition, which is why she visited the Ceprodel offices to solicit a loan to purchase materials such as zinc and purlins and pay for labor.  This will allow her to improve her home and quality of life.  She is grateful for Ceprodel and the loan opportunity as well as the support they have given her to reach her dream.

loans.use: purchase zinc, purlins and pay for labor.

loans.name: Saida Alejandra

texts.es: Saida , esta señora fue la directora de un  centro de salud de la localidad hasta el año pasado, actualmente esta  jubilada , esta señora  presenta una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda,  de construir un cuarto, por eso se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para utilizar en la compra de materiales de construcción  tales como letrina, madera, clavos, puertas, cemento, arena, hierro corrugado, alambre de amarre, hierro liso y mano de obra de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida. Y agradeciéndole a ceprodel por el crédito oportuno y por el apoyo para mejorar sus condiciones de sus vivienda.
texts.en: Saida was the director of a health center in her community until last year when she retired.  Now, she is in need of making improvements to her home and building a new room.  For this reason, she visited the Ceprodel offices to solicit a loan to use in the purchase of construction materials such as a latrine, lumber, nails, doors, cement, sand, corrugated iron, tie wire, smooth iron and labor.  This will allow her to improve the condition of her home and her quality of life.  She is very thankful to Ceprodel for the loan opportunity and the support they have given her to improve the condition of her home.

loans.use: purchase a latrine, lumber, nails, doors, cement, sand, smooth iron and pay for labor.

loans.name: Muhit B Shg Group

texts.en:
Dimngai is the featured borrower member for Muhit B SHG Group. She is pictured with her hand raised, on the extreme left. Twelve women members from the village joined hands and formed the group to support and assist each other financially and morally in times of need. The presence of Dorcas SHG and Sarah SHG in the village gives awareness about the advantage and benefit of a Self Help Group and its existence. All group members reside in a village which is about 35 kms away from the capital town of Imphal, which is one of the North-Eastern States in India.

Dimngai is a hard-working woman and believes in sheer effort to make a living. She raises cattle to generate an income for the family. Her husband earns his living as a farmer and she supplements the family income by raising cattle and weaving traditional women's wrap-around skirts. At present she has two female cows which produce milk. The milk is then sold every day in the neighbourhood. Her daily expenses are managed with her income from selling cow's milk. The cattle are also used on rental for ploughing paddy fields where tractors are not available and the payment is made based on the acres of land that are ploughed. 

Dimngai usually gets the nutritional diet for cattle from the city market to keep the cattle healthy and strong. The cattle are also fed grass and refined dry grass. They are taken to the nearby fields to graze all day and feed on grass. Medical needs are provided on a regular basis whereas cattle are made to work at heavy labour and little care is granted by others. Most of the earnings are generally used to care for the cattle and cover household expenses. 

Dimngai also weaves and sells finished woven wrap-around skirts to those who place an order. Despite working as a weaver and a cattle raiser she finds it hard to manage any monthly savings and she needs to renovate the cattle cow shed which leaked during the rainy season. The cattle are moved from the cow shed to a nearby shelter during rain.

With the Kiva loan, Dimngai will purchase tin roofing, bricks and cement to re-construct the cow shed. She is delighted as the cattle will be kept in a protected shelter and she loves her cattle. She thanks Kiva and WSDS for the wonderful gift of a loan and says that she will repay the loan on time and will continue building good relationships with the organisation. She says “Thank you so much, Kiva!"

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, piggery, vegetable selling, and the rice selling business, etc.

loans.use: To purchase tin roofing, bricks and cement to reconstruct the cow shed for the cattle that she raises to generate an income

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson lives in Mombasa where he operates his own carpentry shop. He is 47 years old, married and has five children. All his five children are in school. He also does poultry farming. 

Johnson learned about Milango through friends and he decided to join so that he could access credit to fund his business. He has a vision of owning his own showroom in the next five years. The major challenge in the business is finding capital to inject into the business. He now seeks a loan to buy timber. The extra income raised from the business will go towards paying school fees for his children. He will also be able to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Sajda

texts.en: Sajda, 38, is a married woman who has sold goats for the past 10 years. Now she has three goats. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. Her husband also assists her in selling goats in the market around Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She is the mother of three children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her 2nd year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. Now she had requested for a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Fanis  Fátima

texts.es: Fanis es una señora preocupada por la Educación de los demás, como profesión es docente de educación Secundaria, de la zona donde habita desde hace 15 años, es casada, con 3 hijos a su cargo .    Actualmente está solicitando un pequeño financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda la cual está en mal estado, y lo utilizara en la compra de arena, cemento, piedrín, zinc, clavos, bloques, hierro y mano de obra de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que con mucho esfuerzos ha venido realizando dichas mejoras apoyada con los financiamientos, por lo tanto le agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo oportuno para realizar sus sueños, de esas manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
Fanis is a woman who is passionate about the education of others, and works as a high school teacher in the community she has lived in for the past 15 years.  She is married with 3 children.

At the moment, she is soliciting a small loan to improve her home which is currently in need of repairs.  She will use the loan to purchase sand, cement, stone, zinc, nails, cinderblocks, iron and pay for labor.  This will allow her to improve her quality of life, as with a lot of effort, she has begun to realize these improvements with the loans.  

She is thankful for Ceprodel and the support they have given her to realize her dreams, and in turn improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase sand, cement, stone, zinc, nails, cinderblocks, iron and labor.

loans.name: Ghulam  Jannat

texts.en:
Ghulam Jannat is a 36-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of milk selling for the past 10 years. She has 2 calves and 2 cows in milk. By this time she has become known for providing good quality milk in her town. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life.

She is the mother of four children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business through its support. Now she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She is very positive about the growth of her business and expects a boost in her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Bunthoeun is a garment worker, while his wife makes typical Cambodian cakes. He has two children: one son and one daughter. Both of the children are in school. 

Bunthoeun lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He is asking for a loan to buy a cow to raise. He will be able to get extra income from selling the calf when the cow gives birth to a baby.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Nazeer

texts.en:
Nazeer is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for the past three years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. Now she has 5 goats and 1 cow.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  Currently she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his daughter's secondary school tuition.

loans.name: Dursun

texts.en:
Dursun is a 68-year-old pensioner from the village of Bobokvati. He is married and lives with his wife, grown son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. The family runs a small-scale agricultural business that has agricultural land where citrus, nuts, kiwis and persimmons are grown. They sell the harvested products at the local market.

Dursun has made multiple loan requests, without success, from local financial institutions in order to start up a trading business. His loan requests were rejected each time due to low income. Dursun’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions. Borrowers are the vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as ‘high-risk borrowers’ because of their low income.

With the received credit, Dursun will purchase basic groceries and set up a store. He plans to increase the turnover in his trading business gradually. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Dursun will work hard and he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family. With this loan, his family will generate enough income to access regular credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event that they need it.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store in his village

loans.name: Marcia María

texts.es:
La señora Marcia  es una mujer luchadora, de profesión  docente de educación  primaria de un colegio de una comunidad de la localidad, es casada  con 2 hijos mayores de edad, 
Una de las necesidades que la señora Marcia  atraviesa hoy en día, es de mejorar sus condiciones  en su vivienda ya que se encuentra en mal  estado, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de  materiales de construcción tales como: bloques, hierro, cemento, zinc y pago de mano de obra la que le brindara  mejores condiciones en su hogar Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporcionara a su familia mejor vida.
texts.en:
Marcia's a woman who strives.  She teaches elementary school in a school in the area.  She's married and has two adult children.

One thing Marcia currently needs is to improve the conditions in her house.  It's in bad shape so she decided to go to CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy construction materials such as cinder blocks, rebar, cement, and metal sheets, and to pay for labor.

It's important to highlight that this work will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 30-year-old married woman. She is expert in embroidery. She makes beautiful-looking embroidery on clothes. Her clients are based in her community and from nearby areas. She makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. With the loan investment she will buy thread, beads, sequins and pearls in different colors that will allow her to fill the clients' orders on time and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy thread, beads, sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo esta separado de su esposa pero tiene un hijo con el que vive en una casa alquilada de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente trabaja como chofer de radio taxi, con esta actividad se mantiene y cubre sus minimas necesidades. Necesita un crédito para la compra de un repuesto debido a que el automovil no esta funcionando como debe y es urgente que compre el repuesto, sino se queda sin trabajar puesto que no tiene conocimientos para dedicarse a otra cosa
texts.en:
Rodolfo is separated from his wife.  However, he has a son with whom he lives in a rented house in the city of La Paz.

He currently works as a radio dispatched taxi driver.  He supports himself with this business activity, and he covers their basic necessities.  

He needs a loan to buy a replacement part.  This is because his automobile is not working as it should.  It is urgent that he buy the part.  If he does not, he will be left without work because he does not know how to do anything else.

loans.use: to buy a replacement part for the vehicle that he works with as a driver.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 40 years old and a married woman. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Nida’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide them with the basic necessities of life. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 20,000, to buy spools of thread with packs of stones, pearls and sequins for embellishment. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread with packs of stones, pearls and sequins embellishment.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 42-year-old, vigorous lady and for the past two years, she has been running a business of cloth sales. She buys printed cloth in various colors and designs from the wholesale markets and then sells it to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Shameem is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Juana Marizol

texts.es:
Juana  es una señora bien Optimista en cuanto al desarrollo académico ostenta la especialidad de Licenciada en administración de empresa, contador y actualmente está estudiando licenciatura en maestra de educación primaria, es Casada con 2 hijos a su cargo, a los  que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen, estudian en los colegios del municipio, tanto en secundaria como en primaria.
Una de las necesidades que la señora  Juana  atraviesa hoy en día es de graduarse como licenciada en educación primaria, producto del gran esfuerzo realizado para alcanzar tan deseado  objetivo, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión sabia de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar los estudios de sus sueños,  el que le beneficiara aun mas en su centro laboral, por el nivel académico que presentaría, lo que de paso le vendría mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is a very optimistic woman.  In her academic development, she boasts a license in business administration, accounting and is currently study to become licensed in primary education.  She is married with two children for whom she must provide all of the necessities to develop.  They study at the community schools, and have done so for both elementary and high school.  

One of Juana's current needs is to graduate with a degree in primary education, a product of the huge effort she has given to reach her objective.  With this need in mind, she made the wise decision to visit Ceprodel to solicit a loan to finish her studies.  This would greatly improve her career prospects due to the academic achievements she would be able to present, which in turn would enhance her quality of life.

loans.use: pay for university classes at UNAN León to become a licensed primary school teacher.

loans.name: Nedar Vicente

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	El Señor Nedar  trabaja  como guarda de seguridad  en un colegio de la comunidad donde vive desde hace 8 años  es casado,  con 4 personas a su cargo  a los que le brinda todo el apoyo para su desarrollo,  actualmente está presentando una necesidad de construir la tapia de su vivienda para tener mayor seguridad , por lo que se decidió visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como; ladrillo rojo, cemento y arena para realizar dicha obra , que tanto necesita y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nedar has worked for eight years as a security guard in a school in the community where he lives.  He's married and is responsible for four people.  He gives them all his support for their growth.

Currently he needs to build a wall around his home to have greater security.  He decided to go to CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy construction materials such as red brick, cement, and sand.

This way he can do the work that's so necessary and improve his living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy red brick, cement, and sand

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her son's secondary school tuition for the year.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his son's secondary school tuition for the year.

loans.name: Rorny

texts.en:
Rorny's family is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia. Rorny and his wife are fishermen. They sell fish that they catch to a middleman who comes to buy at their home or they sell in the local market sometimes.

Rorny lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has three young children--two sons and one daughter. He is applying for a loan in order to buy additional fishing materials.

Rorny is in the photo.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Kubran

texts.en:
Kubran is 42 years old, vigorous, and a married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past seven years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Razia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

Kubran wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls and packs of glittering material in various colors. This will allow her to complete the orders of her customers on time. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls with packs of glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 32 years old and the mother of six children. For the past 15 years, she has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread-earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 41-year-old married woman from Ghana, Dansoman. She has two children; the oldest is 15 while the youngest is 12.

She has a plantain and tomato business, and she works hard to earn a living. 

Due to the high demand for plantain and tomatoes, Janet requested a loan of GHS 3,500 to buy more plantain and tomatoes. 

In the future, Janet would like to manage her business well so she can grow and expand, to send her children to a higher level of education, and to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: To buy more plantain and tomatoes.

loans.name: Everth  Yamir

texts.es: El señor  Everth es un hombre dedicado a impartir el pan de la enseñanza principalmente a los jóvenes, ya que es maestro de educación secundaria de un colegio de la comunidad donde habita, es soltero, este señor se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para plantear una necesidad urgente de mejorar su vivienda ya que se encuentra en mal estado, solicitando un financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de materiales de construcción  tales como: perlines, hierro liso, pintura anticorrosivo, brocha, zinner, lamina negra 0.70,  angulares, electrodos y pago de mano de obra . Y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Everth is a man dedicated to imparting the bread of education, principally to young people. He is a teacher of secondary education in a community college in the town where he lives. He is single.

Everth came to Ceprodel to discuss the urgent necessity of improving his house, which is in bad shape. He desires a loan to purchase construction materials such as roof supports, flat bar iron, anti-corrosive paint, brushes, zinc, black sheeting 0.70, angle iron, welding electrodes, and wages for laborers.

In this manner, he hopes to improve conditions and his level of living.

loans.use: buy construction materials such as: roof supports, flat iron bars, anti-corrosive paint, brushes, zinc, black sheeting, angle iron, welding electrodes, and wages for laborers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 33 años es madre soltera de dos hijas con quienes vive en la casa de su madre. Cuando formó su familia decidió mejorar sus condición de vida, así que comenzó a trabajar en servicios domésticos durante la mañana recibiendo un pago mensual y por las tardes se dedica al cuidado de gallinas, posee 20 ejemplares que cada semana tiene que renovar pues los comercializa a los restaurantes típicos, su sueño es trabajar con mucho esmero para poseer más capital de trabajo y de esa manera aumentar el número de animales y así tener más ganancias. “recién estoy comenzando por ello mi capital de trabajo es escaso”, afirma. Ahora piensa comprar más gallinas pequeñas y de esa manera incrementar su capital de trabajo pues cuestan menos y tiene que esperar unos meses para comercializarlos y obtener más ganancia. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda económica para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Elizabeth, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de más gallinas para luego venderlas a un mejor precio.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 33 years old and is a single mother of two daughters, with whom she lives in her own mother's house.  When she started her family she decided to improve her living conditions, so she starting working as a domestic worker in the mornings for a monthly salary, and raising chickens in the afternoons.  She has 20 animals that she needs to replace every week as she sells them to local restaurants.  Her dream is to work with great effort to have more working capital, and thus to increase the number of animals she owns and thereby inrease her earnings.  "Because I have recently started my working capital is limited", she says.  She is now thinking about buying more small chickens to increase her working capital, because they cost less, however she will need to wait for several months in order to sell them and gain more income.  This is her first loan with KIVA, and she feels that she is developing, as she is receiving the financial help she needs to progress with her business.  For this reason she promises to make her payments punctually.  Elizabeth will use her 1000 soles to  buy more chickens, in order to sell them later at a better price.

loans.use: to buy a large number of chickens.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida, age 25, is an unmarried lady. She had a difficult time after her father’s business failure. She decided to work with her mother to support her family for a better future. She began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

Sajida contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase more spools of thread with packs of laces and zippers in various colors. She is currently in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She dreams of expanding her business to support her family well.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has four years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. 

Kaneez wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of grains, biscuits and cold drinks to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grain, biscuits and cold drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his daughter's tuition for the year at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 52 года, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Айнагул имеет высшее образование. Долгое время работала преподавателем в средней школе. На сегодняшний день она и ее муж пенсионеры, но они не сидят сложав руки, а ведут свое небольшое хозяйство. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1985 году Айнагул начала свой бизнес в откорме скота. Стартовав с 2,000 сом (KGS). Добрые и хорошие отношения в семье дают им хороший результат, а именно   на сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Айнагул имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец. Также имеет земельный надел размером 1,20 ГА, где в основном выращивают фасоль и перец. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота и намерена потратить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 52 yeas old, married, and has two children.  She has a higher education, and for a long time she worked as a high school teacher.  Today, she and her husband are retired, but they don't just sit around the house, rather they run their own small farm.  This is a business that Ainagul started in 1985 to be a source of income for her family.  She started the business with 2,000 som (KGS), but the good relationships that the family members have among themselves have allowed them to be successful.  Today her farm brings in a monthly profit of 10,000 som (KGS).  Ainagul has one milk cow and ten sheep.  She also has 1.2 hectares of land where she mainly grows beans and peppers.

To further develop her business, Ainagul applied to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows.  Ainagul plans to use the profits from the loan to increase the size of her herd of cattle and she intends to spend some money on repairing her home.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Raikan

texts.ru: Райкан, 48 лет, замужем. С 2000 года занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, имеет земельный надел размером 1,20 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает: перец, помидор, капусту, чеснок, фасоль. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития полеводства Райкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Райкан планирует направить на покупку скота, а также в скором будущем хочет женить сына.
texts.en:
Raikan is 48 years old and married.  Since 2000 she has been in the crop farming business.  She started her business with 5,000 som (KGS) and today has a monthly profit of 12,000 som (KGS).  She has been able to develop her business to the point where she has a 1.2 hectare plot of land where every years she grows peppers, tomatoes, cabbage, garlic, and beans.  Her husband and children help her with the business.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Raikan applied to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 10,000 som (KGS) to buy fetilizer for her land.  Raikan plans to use the profits from the loan to buy cattle and, in the near future, to marry off her son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur is from Gyumri town, where he lives with his parents, grandfather, and wife. 

In 2012 Khachatur found a means to make his living by providing a vehicle repair service. He repairs different types of cars, and gathers income for his family. He’s been running his business successfully for about a year, and due to his hard work, Khachatur has gained many loyal customers. Now to improve his business, he needs to purchase additional supplies, so Khachatur is applying for a loan to purchase needed supplies and improve his business.

It is very important for Khachatur to gather more income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to facilitate providing better service to his customers.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio, de 22 años. Vive en compañía de su esposo Ángel con quien tiene 2 hijos, juntos viven en una casa alquilada desde hace 3 años. Rocio se dedica al bordado de faldas típicas de la zona, con estos ingresos puede apoyar a su familia , “ya tengo algunos pedidos, son pocos pero recién estoy comenzando, ahora tengo que aprovechar la temporada festiva de la ciudad en donde todos bailan con faldas”, comenta. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda económica para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Rocío, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de hilos, telas y demás accesorios para los bordados que realiza.
texts.en:
Rocio, 22, lives with her husband Ángel with whom she has two children. They have lived together in a rented house for three years. Rocio makes a living embroidering the skirts that are common to this region. With this income, she is able to support her family.  "I already have some orders, only a few but I'm only just starting. Now I have to take advantage of the city's festive season, when everyone dances in skirts", she states. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels developed because she is getting financial help in order for her business to progress. This is why she promises to be punctual in making her payments. Rocio will invest the 1000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of thread, fabric and other accessories for the embroidery she does.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric and other accessories

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 42, and from the small village of Lanchkhuti district. She is married, and lives with her husband, five-year-old daughter, and her mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law has a retirement pension. 

Tamar is very hard working woman. She has her own grocery shop and works there. In addition, she is involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, she has a plot of land where nut trees are grown. She sells the harvested nuts at local markets at a good price. 

Tamar decided to start a dairy business with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Tamar’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo - the Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of 4,000 Gel, she will purchase a milk cow and a stock of groceries for her shop. 

When the milk cow is purchased, she will be able to produce dairy products and sell them at her shop. She will also purchase a wide range of products to satisfy her customer’s requirements. With this financial support Tamar will expand her grocery store, attract more customers, and expand the dairy farm. 

She promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her daughter's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her son's tuition expenses at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 22-year-old single Lebanese man. He was forced to work at a very young age to supplement the family's income since his relatives passed through bad and hard situations, and he had to do whatever was needed to help his family overcome that. 

He is a plumber who has worked on a freelance basis for the past seven years. To purchase new plumbing tools and supplies such as tubes, faucets, hammers, etc., Ismail is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. He says that these purchases will ease his operations and will even result in a better quality of repairs. In the future, he plans to be the owner of a proper plumbing shop.

loans.use: to purchase new plumbing tools and supplies.

loans.name: San Juan * 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SAN JUAN * 26,  Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete  mujeres y dos varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Maria tiene dos hijos de las edades de  10 y 2 años, ella se dedica a tejido de chompas de lana de alpaca, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana de alpaca por mayor para el tejido de sus chompas y mantas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta ya que hace mucho frio, también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus chompas, su deseo es tener una tienda para poder ofrecer y mostrar sus productos.
texts.en: The communal bank SAN JUAN * 26 is made up of nine members, seven women and two men. The president of the bank is Maria. She has two children, aged 10 and 2. She knits sweaters out of alpaca wool. Her workshop and home are in the area of Alto Tacagua in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Maria is going to use the loan to buy alpaca wool wholesale to knit sweaters and blankets. Around this time is when she has a lot of sales, since it is very cold. She also delivers a lot of orders to different markets in the city of El Alto. Her reason for asking for the loan is to increase her working capital. Maria faces challenges in her business, such as stocking her merchandise. She is going to use the profits to keep buying her materials for knitting the sweaters wholesale. Her wish is to have a store to be able to offer and show her products.

loans.use: to buy wool to knit sweaters.

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en:
Kenedy is 35 years old and married to Zipporah. They have two children aged eight and three years.

He has a transport business, which he has operated for the past two years. He has applied for his fourth loan from KADET ltd to enable him to purchase a motorbike after paying his previous loan successfully. He intends to pay school fees with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, Kenedy hopes to buy a taxi, which will operate in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 41 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 20 and 17 years respectively. She runs a hotel--a business she started 13 years ago--and earns a monthly income of KES 35,900. She has requested a second loan of KES 20,000 to purchase milk, bales of flour, sugar and tea leaves for use in her hotel. The profits she earns will be ploughed back to her business. Her dream is to see this business expand and have a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase milk, bales of flour, sugar and tea leaves for use in her hotel.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 32 years old. She is from Nyandarua south and is single.

Joyce has a money transfer business locally known as Mpesa that she has been running for the past 2 years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET Ltd to enable her buy more air time and increase her float.

She hopes to be able to buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more airtime and increase her float.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Elba, quien con su credikiva pudo adquirir calzados, que le habían solicitado los clientes. Con esta inversión pudo comprar una mayor cantidad de calzado, para ofrecer y vender a los clientes actuales y a nuevos clientes que se han ido sumando al negocio, lo que le ha permitido un aumento ostensible en el volumen de ventas, y por ende mayores ingresos para su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de más calzados, que le están solicitando los clientes. Elba dice a sus financiadores: “Envío mis agradecimientos a Kiva porque que me permite hacer crecer mi negocio”.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Elba. With her Kiva loan she was able to acquire shoes that her customers had asked her for. With this investment, she was able to buy a larger quantity of shoes to offer to old customers and new ones who have come to the business, which has allowed for an evident increase in sales volume and therefore more income for her family. Right now she is asking for a new loan to invest in buying more shoes that her customers are asking her for. Elba tells her lenders: “I give my thanks to Kiva because it allow me to make my business grow”.

loans.use: to invest in buying more shoes that her customers are asking her for.

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.ru: Нурие 42 года, замужем, имеет троих детей. С 2007 года занимается торговлей запасных частей для автомашин стартовав с суммой в 300,000 сом (KGS). Нурия сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 15,000 сом (KGS). Супруг помогает по бизнесу. Бизнес налаженный. Также в хозяйстве имеет: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленка,  и 20 овец, а также имеется земельный надел 1,20 ГА на которой она ежегодно выращивает клевер. В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Нурия обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Нурия  планирует вложить часть доходов в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара и в будущем дайть достойное образование детям.
texts.en:
Nuriya is 42 years old, married, and has three children.  Since 2007 she has been in the auto parts business.  She started her business with 300,000 som (KGS) and she has been able to develop her business to the point where it has a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS).  Her husband helps her with the business and it's all up and running smoothly.  

Nuriya also has two milk cows, one calf, and 20 sheep, as well as a 1.2 hectare plot of land where she grows clover.  

In order to expand the assortment of auto parts she offers, Nuriya applied to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  Nuriya plans to use a part of the income from the loan in further expanding her product line and, in the future, to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila, 40, is from the village of Giorgitsminda and is married to Avtandil. They have three children, two daughters who work at the supermarket as salesladies and a son who is a school attendant. Leila and Avtandil fight for their children's future because they want them to become good people and to be able to study to progress in life.

The family runs an agricultural business and breeds three pigs and eight piglets. They also own a calf and several hens. Leila sells pork, piglets and eggs at the local open-air market.

All the family members work hard, but the existing income is not enough for a five-member family. 

She has requested this loan to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables to start her business and generate revenue. Leila will sell products in her village among the community members.

The new business initiative, financed by Kiva lenders, will significantly increase the monthly income of the family and will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hodan

texts.en:
Hodan is seeking a loan to support half of her son’s tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology. Hodan’s son, Zakariye, is a junior at the school. Hodan is a single mother of eight children. She lives in Hargeisa with her eldest son and his family. Hodan is retired and no longer able to work.

This Kiva loans provides an important opportunity for Zakariye and his family. The program allows Zakariye to complete high school and reduces the financial burden on his mother and the rest of the family. His family sees the importance in sending him to Abaarso because of its ability to open his mind to the outside world. Abaarso School provides a way for Zakariye and his classmates to improve their community and exposes them to a wide variety of people and experiences.

Zakariye says, “Abaarso School embodies three remarkable virtues, which are critical thinking, tenacity, and integrity.” He experienced cheating in other schools; Abaarso provides an ethical education. He also appreciates the ability to learn English. He believes that because of his education at Abaarso, he and his classmates will become the leaders of tomorrow.

Upon graduation from Abaarso, Zakariye hopes to attend college and become a peace negotiator. Growing up, he was exposed to numerous conflicts and hopes that he can work in order to bring peace and order to his country and the world.

loans.use: to pay for half of her son's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Sarpingul

texts.en:
Sarpingul is 44 years old. She is the only source of food and the keeper of her children. She has four children and she is a widow. It is very difficult for her to generate income for her children as she works at a hospital as a cleaning woman. She has a small salary. Sarpingul lives poorly with her children in the house of her late husband in the southern part of Tajikistan. She buys food products for them to live. 
Her brother has no job in Tajikistan and that’s why he wants to go abroad to find a job and source of income. He has no money to buy an airplane ticket. He asked his sister Sarpingul to buy an airplane ticket for him. Sarpingul is asking for a loan of 2500 TJS (Tajikistan somoni) to buy a ticket. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an airplane ticket for her brother

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 5 hijos en la casa que heredó de su madre. Nancy se dedica a la venta de comidas y ropa variada de manera ambulatoria ya tiene 15 años dedicándose a estos negocios, por eso todos la conocen y aprecian mucho, además de ser la única que brinda el servicio de comidas. Pero tambien los pobladores de su localidad se siente agradecidos con ella, pues deja al crédito algunas prendas, para poder pagar después. Ahora desea incrementar sus ganancias para poder poner una tienda de venta de ropa estable y así no tener que vender como ambulante de casa en casa. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda económica para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Nancy; invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de ropa variada para su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy, age 46, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband and their five children in the house that she inherited from her mother.

Nancy sells food and varied clothing in an itinerant manner.  She has been working in these businesses for 15 years.  That is why everyone knows her and greatly values her, in addition to being the only one who provides food service.  The residents in her area are also grateful to her.  She gives credit for some garments so they are able to pay later.

She now wants to increase her earnings in order to be able to set up a stable place, a store, to sell clothes.  This way she will not have to sell by going door to door.

This is her third loan with Kiva.  She feels that she has grown because she is getting the financial help to make progress in her business.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  Nancy will use the 1,500 soles to buy varied clothing for her business.

loans.use: to buy varied clothing.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 22-year-old single Lebanese woman. She cooperates financially with her parents to meet their life needs. Her mother works as a housekeeper, and her father works as a driver. It's difficult for them to earn enough money. 

As for Zeinab, she has owned a grocery store since 2011 where she sells canned food, bread, chocolate, cheese, soft drinks, etc. To expand her store's inventory of food provisions and drinks, she is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. 

She estimates that both her sales and income will increase by approximately 20% after getting the loan. Zeinab shows high enthusiasm to receive the loan, as she is very eager to enlarge her trade and later on to sell new products.

loans.use: to expand her store inventory of food provisions and drinks.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 28 years old and is from Naivasha. He is married with two children who are in school.
