David is a conductor of a mini-bus transport business and has been in it for the past 6 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy a cow, which will help his dairy sales and help him boost his business.

He hopes to own a fleet of vehicles in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Flordelize

texts.en:
Flordelize is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Flordelize has a buy and sell charcoal and firewood business in the Philippines. Flordelize requested a 14000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of charcoal and firewood to sell.

Flordelize has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Flordelize would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of charcoal and firewood to sell

loans.name: Jassa

texts.en:
Jassa lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia. She is 31 years old, has completed 12th grade, is unmarried, and has two children, ages seven and one years old, who live at home. Only the oldest one is in school.

For the past seven years she has been selling pepper, oil, onions, vita, rice, etc., in the community market. She started this business with help from her fiancé and learned this way of selling from him. 

She spends eight hours a day with her business, and she uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her table. She says, "I am a business-minded person, and I like my business because it gives me more profit." 

She is requesting a loan to buy more pepper, oil, onions, vita, rice, etc., to increase her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children and to build a house. She appreciates Kiva for its support.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, onions, vita, rice, etc., to increase her sales.

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Korto lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County where the living conditions are almost like the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as a well laid out place in Liberia. She is 35 years old and married with four children, ages ranging between 19 and 10, all of whom are in school and living at home.

For the past 16 years she has been selling oil, Vita, salt, oil, Bitter Boy, etc. She started her business with money from her husband and learned this method of selling from her mother. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours on her business. Most of the time she uses a taxi to transport her goods to her table.

Korto described herself as a hardworking businesswoman, and she said she likes her business because of the way it makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, Vita, salt, oil, Bitter Boy, etc. to expand her sales. Her wishes are to own a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, Vita, salt, oil, Bitter Boy, etc. to expand her sales

loans.name: Osafo's Group

texts.en:
Osafo represents this group. He is thirty-seven, married and has two children aged five and ten years old, both children are currently attending school. 

For the last 13 years Osafo has sold bags. His business strategy is to barter with customers to get the best price. He sells the bags one at a time or in bulk, so the price differs according to the number each customer buys.

Osafo has received eight previous loans through ID Ghana, Kiva's partner, and has a good repayment record. He is now applying for a 2,400 GHS (Ghanaian Cedi) loan so that he could buy plenty and make more profit. He will use his ninth loan to buy more bags to sell.

Osafo would like to open a big store one day. He hopes his children will finish their education and be able to travel overseas to continue their education.

The other member is also requesting a loan of 700 GHS to buy and sell Milo beverages.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell.

loans.name: Mirembe Women2 Group

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with four children of whom two are school-going. She is a repeat borrower in her second cycle and is borrowing a loan of 600,000 UGX to buy firewood to supply a nearby school. This reduces the cost of the school since firewood is cheap. She supplements the business by selling snacks to the students and staff of the same school.

The money borrowed will help her to improve her businesses and she will soon buy a plot of land for her children in the near future. She is so grateful to the funders for the help they provide to low income earners like her group.

The person in a red dress third at the front is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy firewood to sell

loans.name: Cidian

texts.es:
Cidian es una joven de 28 años de edad agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 4 hijos, la mayor tiene 15 años y está cursando el primer año de bachillerato en administración de empresas a distancia, la segunda hija tiene 13 años y está cursando el segundo año de ciclo común básico, la tercer hija tiene 8 años y cursa  el segundo año del nivel escolar y el menor de sus hijos que tiene 5 años y está en  pre-escolar. Ella en compañía de su esposo se dedica al cultivo de café realizando actividades como limpieza, abono, corte, recolecta entre otras. Ella aprendió esta actividad desde niña con sus padres ya que ellos son agricultores por tradición familiar y la tierra que juntos trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia familiar la cual está ubicada cerca de su casa de habitación. Los clientes que ella tiene son bodegas que exclusivamente se dedican a la compra-venta de café en otras localidades cercanas de donde ella vive.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL que permitirá adquirir suministros agrícolas, como chapola (plantitas de café), también comprara abono y otra parte la destinara para la preparación de una manzana de tierra que será donde siembre la chapola que comprara y así al final del proceso obtener una excelente producción. 

Su mayor anhelo y más grande sueño es poder graduar a sus 4 hijos de la universidad para que en el futuro puedan valerse por sí mismos ya que con lo que ellos ganan no les alcanza para dejarles un patrimonio digno y puedan enfrentar de manera favorable los problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Cidian is a 28-year-old young lady who is of farming age and is a housewife. She is the mother of four children. The oldest is 15 and is in her first year of high school away from home, studying business administration. Her second child is 13 and is studying her second year of the basic core curriculum. Her third child is eight and is in her second year of school, and the youngest of her children is five and is in preschool. 

She and her husband make a living cultivating coffee, performing tasks such as cleaning, composting, cutting, collecting, and other things. She learned how to do this alongside her parents when she was a child, since they are farmers by family tradition and the land they work together is their own thanks to a family inheritance. It is located close to their home. The clients she has are warehouses that are exclusively dedicated to the buying and selling of coffee in other locations near where she lives.

She has requested financing from the Comixmul cooperative in order to be able to acquire agricultural supplies such as coffee seedlings, as well as to buy compost. The rest will be used in the preparation of a 7000 square meter parcel of land that will be where she sows the coffee seedlings that she will buy, and that way at the end of this process she will have excellent production.

Her greatest desire and biggest dream is to be able to have her four children graduate from universities so that in the future they can fend for themselves, since with what she and her husband earn, they will not have enough to leave them a worthy inheritance. This way, they will be able to take on their economic problems in a favorable way.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and coffee seedlings to plant, and to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 43 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Isabel y sus hijos en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Alejandro se dedica al trabajo de construcción por eso encontramos a Alejandro trabajando en el asfaltado de la carretera hacia su pueblo y se siente muy contento con este trabajo pues los pobladores tendrán una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo mayor acceso para llevar las cosechas de alimentos a la ciudad para ser vendidos. Desde  hace algunos años se dedica a este tipo de trabajo y en la actualidad  se encuentra trabajando en esta obra civil, en compañía de algunos de sus colegas y espera poder obtener una buena ganancia por ello, “tengo que aprovechar esta oportunidad, es dinero seguro y pagan bien”, afirma. Como hijo del campo también se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, sembrando productos agrícolas y criando ovejas y ganado vacuno. Este es su segundo crédito con KIva, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Alejandro, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de herramientas para  sus trabajos en construcción.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 43, is a responsible man.  He lives with his wife Isabel and his children in the house he bought a few years ago.

Alejandro earns a living in construction.  He's working on asphalting the highway to his town.  He's very happy about this job because the residents will have a better quality of life and, especially, greater access to take their harvests to the city to sell.

He has worked in this field for some years, and currently he's working on this public project with some of his coworkers.  He hopes to be able to earn a good profit.  "I have to make this most of this opportunity.  It's certain money and it pays well," he says.

As a son of the fields he also works in farming and ranching, growing agricultural products and raising sheep and dairy cows.

This is his second Kiva loan.  He's grateful for the financial support received because it will allow him to improve his income.  He promises to make his payments punctually.

Alejandro will invest the 1500 soles in tools for his construction jobs.

loans.use: to buy construction tools

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan sigue con la misma actividad que es el del servicio de construcción y pintado de ambientes, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de material para su trabajo, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de material de construcción como variedad de pinturas, para realizar su trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en: Juan has the same job, which is construction and painting. He says that things went well for him with the previous loan, since he used it to buy materials for his work. This time, he is applying for the loan to buy construction materials like an assortment of paints to do his job. He feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that they have given him, since he is growing and improving his work.

loans.use: to buy materials like paint for his job

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is twenty four years, married to Hussein and a mother of one child. She has been selling fruits for five years; however, she recently started selling charcoal too. She earns a monthly income of twelve thousand shillings. 

This will be Gladys' third loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire amount to buy charcoal to sell. In the future she wants to become a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 53-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business of cloths sales for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 
To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan of 300,000 Rs. (Pakistani rupee) from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. 
She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season.

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal is 56 years old. He is divorced and lives in a small village of Gori District with his retired mother. Jemal runs an agricultural business and grows apples, maize and grapes on the family-owned land.

With the requested funds, Jemal will purchase tomato seedlings and plant them in his own plot of land. His loan request was approved in the frames of a joint initiative beteeen Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions for business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's vulnerable poor population, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

Jemal has already cultivated the land and with the credit he receives, he will purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting. Jemal will work hard on his plot of land during the season to get a good harvest. He will sell harvested tomatoes on the Gori market. The family will get additional income and he will be able to improve his family's living conditions. In addition to the above-mentioned benefits of the loan, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 56 years old and married to Ann. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past 13 years. He has applied for his fifth loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy fertilizer and chemicals, and to pay for labour. He repaid his previous loans in good time.

With the anticipated profits, Peter hopes to expand his farming business and also save some of the money.

In the near future Peter hopes to expand his farm and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals, and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a man of thirty-nine years. He is married to Lilian and is a father of five children. He runs a taxi business and has been in this business for six years now; he earns a monthly income of thirty-five thousand shillings.

This will be Peter's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire amount to buy two new tires and spray for the car. In future he wants to own a public vehicle.

loans.use: To buy two new tires and spray for the taxi

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 37 years old, married to Grace, and they have two children aged eight and three years old. 

He has a general shop in Ndunyu Njeru which he has operated for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy a power saw. With the anticipated profits, he plans to build rental houses on his plot.

In the near future, Henry hopes to apply for a bigger loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to complete the construction of rental houses.

loans.use: To buy a power saw machine.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a 26-year-old businessman, is married to Justina and together they are blessed with one child aged two years. Peter has been in the transport business for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family. He also runs an electronics shop which supplements his income.

His previous loan repaid, Peter is requesting his second loan with KADET to service his motorbike and invest in his child’s education. With the anticipated profit, he will improve the living standards of his family.

Peter's dream is to construct a permanent residential house for his family.

loans.use: to service his motorbike and invest in his child’s education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his son's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Lernik

texts.en:
Lernik is from the town of Gyumri. He lives with his wife, two daughters, son and daughter-in-law. Near the town where they live, Lernik owns a plot of agricultural land, where he cultivates potatoes. He has been involved in land cultivation for many years, and it has become a source of income, which brings Lernik financial stability.

Lernik is a very hardworking farmer and a lovely father for his family. He sells gathered potatoes to local retailers and makes income. Now, this hardworking father needs financial support for organizing the cultivation process. He has requested this loan in order to purchase fertilizer, which is very important for the successful cultivation of the land. But what is most important: Lernik will be able to cover watering costs and gather a good harvest! The loan is very important for Lernik to be able to continue his farming business and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and cover watering costs

loans.name: Maliha

texts.en:
With her previous loan, Maliha was able to expand her mini market. She worked hard and repaid her loan early. After surveying her customers and potential customers, Maliha decided to further expand her stock and introduce gift items and household goods. Maliha planned on her expansion in preparation of Ramadan and increased holiday buying. This is why she made sure she was able to repay her first loan and request a new larger one for her current expansion.

Maliha's immediate goals are to help her son in buying his home and getting him married. She wants to see her store grow from strength to strength.

loans.use: To expand her stock and include gift items and household goods in her store

loans.name: Mariela Auxiliadora

texts.es: Mariela una humilde joven habitante del barrio 30 de Mayo, su esposo es albañil con quien procreo dos hijos los cuales están estudiando. Mariela se dedica a la venta de refrescos de chicha, una bebida típica de Nicaragua hecha a base de maíz fermentado, también vende golosinas y productos como granos básicos. Ella solicita el crédito para invertir en materia prima como maíz, frambuesa y vainilla para hacer refrescos, entre otros aceite, arroz, azúcar, esta es la manera de ganarse la vida de Mariela, quien intenta salir adelante y tiene la esperanza de ir creciendo con el tiempo para continuar brindándole los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mariela is a humble young woman living in the 30 de Mayo neighborhood. Her husband is a construction worker, with whom she has two children who are in school. Mariela works selling chicha soft-drinks, a typical Nicaraguan beverage made from fermented corn. She also sells candies and products like staple goods. She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials like corn, raspberry, and vanilla to make drinks. Also, she will buy oil, rice, and sugar. This is a way of making a living for Mariela, who is trying to move forward and hopes to continue growing with time in order to continue giving her children an education.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Walter Ivan

texts.es: Walter, tiene 29 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposa en una aldea del municipio de Nueva Frontera  Santa Bárbara. El tiene 13 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos de donde cubre sus gastos del hogar. El café lo vende en el mercado local. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos. El préstamo que solicito es por 15,000 lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y pago a personas para la limpieza de su finca. Su meta es lograr el incremento de la producción de café y asi poder obtener mayor utilidad.
texts.en: Walter, 29, has two children and lives with his wife in a village in the municipality of Nueva Frontera Santa Bárbara. He has worked growing coffee for 13 years. This work is his source of income from which he meets his household expenses. He sells the coffee in the local market. He has always worked farming staple goods. The loan he is asking for is 15,000 lempiras, which he will use to buy fertilizers and pay people to weed his farm. His goal is to increase his coffee production and that way earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow coffee and to pay people to weed the farm.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 39 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has three children between the ages of 6 and 19; all three are attending school. 

Since 2003 she has been selling rice, oil, coal etc. in the local market. She started with coal and then started trying other products. Her favorite part of the year is the dry season (from late October through May) because it's the time when she makes more money that allows her to send her children to school. 

Oretha is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, coal etc. to increase her sales. She wants to grow and improve her business to buy pieces of land and build a house, as well as educate her children. She would like to thank the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, coal etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal APU KCAMER, el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Huarqui en el distrito de Coya, provincia de Calca, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Marina tiene 53 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesania, la socia vende lo que son chompas, chalinas, guantes entre otros a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y mercadería para la venta de artesanía.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the community bank APU KCAMER. The bank is located in the community of Huarqui in the Coya distrist, Calca province, Cusco department.

The partner Marina is 53 years old, is single and has 2 children. The partner alternates her daily activities with a business selling crafts; she sells sweaters, scarves, gloves, among others, to her clients that request them. 

At the same time, the partner is engaged in agriculture, being in this way that the partner pulls her family ahead.

The partner is asking for the loan to buy compost, fertilizer and merchandise for the sale of crafts.

The partner feels grateful for the loan granted, and promises to meet the established quotas.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers and merchandise to sell crafts.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre, age 52, is a construction worker from the town of Kutaisi. He is married with a 22-year-old son who is a basketball referee and gets a small monthly salary. Aleksandre’s wife lives and works abroad to help her family financially.

Their existing income is hardly enough to cover everyday expenses, which is why Aleksandre decided to find an additional job and work as a car mechanic. He needs special equipment to implement his plan.

With this startup loan, Aleksandre will purchase a cold welding machine and begin working at an automobile repair shop. He will serve local drivers and receive a service fee.

Aleksandre hopes that his initiative will be profitable and his wife will be able to return to the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cold welding machine and begin working as a car mechanic

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a resident of the Mukuru informal settlement of Nairobi, Kenya. He has lived there for fourteen years with his wife and three children. He owns and operates an electronics repair shop at the same location since he moved into the slum.

When Simon came across a Fresh Life Toilet for the first time, he was impressed by the impact it had on the residents of the urban settlement. He developed a desire to own one of these toilets and therefore seeks a loan to fund the purchase of two Fresh Life Toilets. These toilets will enable him and the other residents of Mukuru to have a safer and cleaner living environment.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Doris Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal APU KCAMER, el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Huarqui en el distrito de Coya, provincia de Calca, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Doris Antonieta tiene 50 años de edad es viuda y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche, papas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como azúcar.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This borrower belongs to the Apu KCamer communal bank. The bank is located in the Huarqui community in Coya district, Calca province, in Cusco department. Doris Antonieta is 50 years old. She is a widow and has one son. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells different products like rice, sugar, milk, and potatoes among other things. She has been in this business awhile. It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible and diligent person, this being the way in which she moves her family forward. She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise for her business, like sugar. She is grateful for the loan provided and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business, like sugar.

loans.name: Eva Angelina

texts.es: Eva, tiene  29 años de edad, esta soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en una aldea del municipio de San Marcos, Santa  Bárbara. Hace 4 años inicio una pulpería donde vende productos de canasta básica familiar como ser:   granos básicos, embutidos, pasta dental, harina, huevo, pan, especies, cereal,etc.  Los fines de semana y por temporadas también vende comida para obtener otros ingresos. Con el objetivo de mantener surtido y activo su negocio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para la compra de productos como pan, embutidos, pasta dental, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, huevos, churros, etc. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y así poder ayudar a su hijo para que pueda culminar los estudios.
texts.en: Eva, 29, is single. She has a son and lives in a village of the municipality of San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. Four years ago, she started a grocery store where she sells products from the basic family basket like: bulk grains, lunch meats, toothpaste, flour, eggs, bread, spices, cereals, etc. On weekends and seasonally, she also sells food to earn more income. With the goal of keeping her business stocked and active, she has decided to apply for a loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy goods like bread, lunch meats, toothpaste, rice, beans, sugar, lard, eggs, churros, etc. Her goal is to grow her business and that way be able to help her son so that he can finish his schooling.

loans.use: to buy products like lunch meats, toothpaste, rice, flour, beans, churros, eggs, bread, etcetera to stock the business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal APU KCAMER, el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Huarqui en el distrito de Coya, provincia de Calca, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Victoria tiene 47 años de edad es casada  y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pollipapas (papas fritas con pollo frito), la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, papas, pollo entre otros para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This group member belongs to the Apu Kcamer communal bank. The bank is located in the Huarqui community in Coya district, Calca province, in Cusco department. Victoria, 47, is married and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling pollipapas (fried potatoes with fried chicken). She has had her business for awhile. It is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible and diligent person, this being the way that she moves her family forward. She is applying or the loan to buy ingredients for her business like oil, potatoes, and chicken among other things. She is grateful for the loan given and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like oil, potatoes, and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his son's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es: Luis a sus 22 años de edad, es padre de un bebé de 1 año y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde hace 8 años aprendió las labores del campo, ya que le colaboraba a su padre y, desde hace 5 años trabaja en una finca como ordeñador. Su trabajo lo alterna con la actividad agrícola, pues posee cultivos de papa criolla y fríjol en un pequeño lote arrendado. El titular es un joven activo, dinámico, emprendedor y dedicado a su familia y a sus labores. Se decide a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fungicidas, larvicidas, fertilizantes) y además pagará 30 horas de alquiler de tractor (valor de cada hora $38.000) con el fin de darle continuidad al cuidado de sus cultivos y tener una cosecha con productos de muy buena calidad, para venderlos a mejor precio en el mercado, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos para darle el sustento diario a su familia. Luis, sueña con ser propietario de una parcela, donde pueda tener sus cultivos y así ahorrar el dinero que paga por el arriendo del terreno, lo cual se verá reflejado en mayor rentabilidad y le permitirá tener una estabilidad económica para que su hijo crezca y se desarrolle en un ambiente sano con mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luis, 22, is father to a 1-year-old baby and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner. Eight years ago, he learned to work in the fields, since he worked with his father. For 5 years, he has been working on a farm as a milker. His work alternates with agricultural activity, as he owns Creole potato and bean crops on a small leased plot. The loan recipient is an active, dynamic, enterprising young man and is devoted to his family and his work. 

Luis decided to request this loan to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies (manure, fungicides, larvicides, and fertilizer) and to also pay to rent a tractor for 30 hours (each hour is worth $38,000 Colombian pesos) in order to give continuity to the care of his crops and have a harvest with high quality products. This way, he can sell them at a better price in the market, which will allow him to increase his revenue in order to give daily livelihood to his family.

Luis dreams of owning a plot where he could have his crops, thus saving the money that he pays to lease land. That will be reflected in higher profitability and will allow him to have economic stability so that his child grows and develops in a healthy environment with better living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (manure, fungicides, larvicides, and fertilizer) and to also pay to rent a tractor for 30 hours.

loans.name: Nolvia Aracely

texts.es: Nolvia, tiene 34 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive con su esposo en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Ella lleva más de  8 años de haber iniciado su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende verduras, refrescos, productos enlatados, azúcar, manteca, harina, arroz, churros, pan,  etc. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos de donde apoya a su esposo con  gastos del hogar.  Ha mantenido el negocio mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. El préstamo que solicito es por 10,000 lempiras y es el decimo ciclo con ODEF, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de productos para el negocio como granos básicos, refrescos, churros, manteca, azúcar, huevos, condimentos, productos de limpieza etc. Su meta es seguir preparando a sus hijos en la educación y surtir cada dia más su negocio para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Nolvina is 34 years old. She has three children and lives with her husband in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. 

It has been more than eight years since her started her own business, a grocery store where she sells vegetables, soft drinks, dairy products, sugar, corn flour, flour, rice, churros, bread, etc. This business is her source of income from which she supports her husband with household expenses. 

She has kept the business by investing several loans. The loan request is for 10,000 lempiras and is the tenth cycle with ODEF. It will be invested in the purchase of products for the business, such as staple foods, soft drinks, churros, corn flour, sugar, eggs, condiments, cleaning products, etc. 

Her goal is to continue preparing her children in education and fill her business more each day to earn better income.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store, such as soft drinks, bread, sweets, sausages and corn flour.

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Carmen es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, mujer trabajadora, humilde, junto a su compañero de Vida lucha dia a dia para sacar adelante a su hijo. su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. ella trabaja vendiendo Frutas y Verduras, su compañero trabaja como agricultor, entre los dos se dividen los gastos del hogar. con este credito doña Carmen comprara Frutas y Verduras ya que la venta esta aumentando mucho y sus clientes le exigen mas productos por lo que tiene que invertir para poder obteber mayores ganancias. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado con este financiamiento.
texts.en: Carmen is a resident of the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a hardworking and humble woman who live together with her partner. She fights every day to make sure her son gets ahead in life, and her dream is to improve their quality of life. She works selling fruits and vegetables while her partner works as a farmer. Between the two of them they cover the costs of living. With this loan Carmen will purchase fruits and vegetables, as her sales have increased a great deal and her customers are demanding more produce. She must invest this money in order to be able to increase her earnings. She is grateful for the support of AFODENIC and Kiva, who have provided her with this funding.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Ivania habitante del barrio la primavera, una zona marginal de Managua, su esposo trabaja como conductor de transporte público, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes, solamente uno está bajo su cargo quien está estudiando. Doña Ivania se dedica a la venta de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite en su casa de habitación, siendo sus principales clientes los vecinos del barrio, ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en terminar un cuarto que le hace falta construirle otra pared, esto con el objetivo de tener mayor seguridad dentro de su hogar y sobre todo un poco mas de espacio, para la familia.
texts.en: Ivania is a resident of the Primavera neighborhood, an area on the outskirts of Managua. Her husband works as a public transportation conductor, and all of her children have grown to adulthood and independence. Only one still lives under her roof and is currently studying. Ivania works selling staple goods such as rice, beans, sugar, and oil out of her home, where her principal customers are her neighbors and local residents. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase building materials to finish a room for which she still needs to build another wall. This is being done to increase the security of her home and above all to create a little more space for her family.

loans.use: purchase cement, bricks, sand, rebar, quarry stone, zinc, and purlins.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer soltera de 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el Barrio San Antonio Sololá, Sololá. 
Ella se dedica al trabajo de campo, cultivando cebolla y lo realiza a unos metros de su vivienda. Decidió aprender está labora porque es un trabajo parcial por lo que le da tiempo de realizar otras actividades. 
A través de lo que realiza le genera  ingresos buenos que le ayudan aportar a la económica de su  familia. Actualmente lleva 8 años de realizar  este tipo de labor, que gracias a las enseñanzas de sus  padres  ahora ella puede desenvolverse en esta área que es bastante productiva.
Ella ha observado que necesita tener más capital para poder cultivar por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para comprar semillas de cebolla y abono orgánico que servirá para su cultivo.
Ella nos comenta que entre sus sueños esta: seguir invirtiendo en su cultivo para generar más ganancias y así poder construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carmen is a single, 25-year-old woman. She lives together with her parents in Barrio San Antionio Sololá, Sololá.

She earns her living in farming, growing onions a few meters from her house. She decided to learn this trade because it is part-time work, which gives her time to pursue other activities. Through her work, she generates a good income that helps her to support her family's finances. At this time, she has been doing this type of work for eight years; thanks to her parents' instruction, she can now hold her own in this field, which is quite productive.

Carmen has observed that she needs to have more capital to be able to farm, so she is requesting a loan of 7,000.00 GTQ to buy onion seeds and organic fertilizer that she will use to cultivate them.

She tells ADICLA that one of her dreams is to continue investing in her crops in order to generate more earnings so that she will be able to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and organic fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es: Isabel de 41 años es  separada con 03 hijos,  02 de ellos aún dependientes, ella pertenece al grupo  “Sarita Colonia” conformada por 06 socios responsables que buscan mejorar cada día. Isabel es la tesorera del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de golosinas y confiterías. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de golosinas  y confiterías. El grupo “Sarita Colonia” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Isabel se encuentra sentada y viste  chompa blanca.
texts.en:
Isabel, 41 years old, is separated with three children, two of whom are still dependent. She belongs to the group Sarita Colonia, comprised of six responsible partners who are looking to improve every day. 

Isabel is the treasurer of the group, a position she has taken responsible. Currently, she makes her living selling sweets and confectionery. Thanks to her efforts, she can bring her children a better quality of life. 

To continue implementing her business is her greatest wish. She will use the requested loan to buy sweets and candy. 

The Sarita Colonia group thanks the people who have made this loan possible. Isabel can be seen sitting wearing a white sweater.

loans.use: to buy sweets and candy.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal APU KCAMER, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Huarqui en el distrito de Coya, provincia de Calca, departamento de Cusco.

El socio Daniel tiene 48 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando como albañil, el socio trabaja en las distintas obras que le solicitan como construcciones entre otros, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo.

El socio se siente agradecido con los inversionistas de kiva y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner is part of the communal bank APU KCAMER. The bank is located in the community of Huarqui in the Coya district, Calca province, Cusco department.

The partner Daniel is 48 years old, married and has one son. The partner alternates his daily activities working as a bricklayer. He works in a variety of projects that ask for him, such as construction among others. 

The partner has spent a long time doing this work, which goes well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work every day. The partner is a responsible person, and in this way he pulls his family ahead.

The partner is asking for the loan to buy tools for his work.

The partners feels grateful for the Kiva lenders and promises to follow the established fees.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José un hombre casado de 48 años de edad, vive  junto a su familia que está integrada por sus 10 hijos (6 hombres y 4 mujeres)  y su esposa,  quienes viven en el Caserío Chuarixché, Cantón el Tablón, Sololá,  Sololá.
Es un  hombre trabajador dispuesto a salir a delante con su familia trabajando fuertemente en la agricultura. Se dedica al cultivo de papa a unos metros de su vivienda.
El aprendió este trabajo con sus padres desde  pequeño y ahora con su esposa y sus hijos lleva 20  años cultivando este tipo de verdura, es de esta manera en donde el obtiene ingresos económicos aceptables para poder  mantener a su familia.
Por la temporada del año es donde el precio de algunas verduras mejoran por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de  Q 6,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa y abono orgánico para luego cultivarlos, cosecharlos y poder venderlos en el mercado local.
Sueña con generar más ganancias a través de su cultivo, para pode remodelar su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old and lives together with his family, made up of his 10 children (six sons and four daughters) and his wife, in the village of Chuarixché, in the district of Tablon, near the city of Sololá in the department of Sololá.

José is a hardworking man who strives to get his family ahead through his work as a farmer. He grows potatoes right near his home. He learned this work from his parents from a young age, and now with his wife and children he has been farming this vegetables for 20 years. In this way he earns a fair living in order to provide for his family. 

At this time of year the price of various vegetables improves, which is why he is requesting a loan of Q 6,000.00 to purchase potato seeds and organic fertilizer to plant later, harvest, and sell in the local market. 

José hopes to generate enough income through his farming to be able to remodel his home and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: purchase seeds for potato and organic fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and operate One Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Susana ella es casada, tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche gaseosas, golosinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negoció ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, a la vez la socia cuenta con otro negocio de restaurante siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tejidos de chompas, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de restaurante, venta de mates, venta de verduras.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Las Palmeras" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco. 

This member is Susana. Susana is married; she is 46 years old and she has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, snacks, and more. She has had this business for a good amount of time and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She hopes to be able to continue working in this way to keep supporting her family. At the same time, this member also has a restaurant business, which is how she keeps her family going. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of merchandise like rice, sugar, and more. 

The other members earn their livings via a handicrafts sales business, a knit sweater business, a taxi service, a restaurant business, carved gourd sales, and vegetable sales. The members that appear in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons. 

Susana is grateful to those who are part of this dream via this medium and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like rice, sugar, and more.

loans.name: Pedro Rolando

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre soltero de 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos (1 hombre y 3 mujeres) en el Caserío Monte Mercedes, Aldea Sacsiguán, Sololá, Sololá.
Es una persona trabajadora dispuesto a seguir apoyando a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida. El se dedica al cultivo de cebolla a unos metros de su vivienda.
Desde hace muchos años el aprendió a trabajar en el campo de la agricultura ya que es la primera actividad que le enseño su padre. Esta actividad le genera ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de la alimentación y vestuario de su familia. 
El desea incrementar su cultivo y es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,500.00 para comprar semillas de cebolla y abono orgánico para cultivarlo y venderlo en el mercado local.
Su sueño es mejorar sus ganancias y construir su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a hardworking, 32 year old man who lives together with his four children (one son and three daughters) in Monte Mercedes, near the town of Sacsiguán, in the department of Sololá. He is a hardworking person striving to support his family and improving their living conditions. He works farming onions right near his home.

Many years ago he learned to work in the fields as a farmer; it was the first work that his father taught him. This activity generates sufficient income and earnings for him to cover the household expenses of his family. He hopes to increase his crop, and for this reason he is requesting a loan of Q 6,500.00 to purchase onion seed and organic fertilizer to harvest and sell in the local market. 

His goal is to improve his earnings and build his home in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: purchase onion seed and organic fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora María Yolanda de 42 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,   se dedica desde hace ya varios años al negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas.
Doña María Yolanda su clientes son personas que la visitan de restaurantes y personas que llegan a su casa a comprar las tortillas para el almuerzo y cena.
Doña María Yolanda Solicita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal que son la materia prima que necesita para elaborar las tortillas, también necesita  para mejorar su  vivienda. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella espera mejorar sus ingresos y comprar lo que necesita para seguir trabajando.
Doña María Yolanda sueño  es mejorar su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
María Yolanda is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and their five children in their house, which is located in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. 

María Yolanda has earned a living for several years in the business of making and selling tortillas. Her customers are people who visit her from restaurants and people who arrive at her house to buy tortillas for lunch and dinner. 

María Yolanda is requesting the loan for the purchase of corn, firewood, and lime powder, which are the raw materials she needs to make tortillas. She also needs to improve her house. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her income and buy what she needs to continue working. María Yolanda's dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2013

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime powder for her business.

loans.name: Wetu

texts.en:
Wetu is 32 years old and lives in the West Point area. She is a high school graduate and has a five-year-old child who lives at home and is already attending school. Wetu is an experienced business woman, having been in business for the past six years. Her dream all started with just 1,000 LRD, and today she manages her own table business that generates thousands of LRD.

Wetu has requested a loan to purchase more used clothes, as her customers increase on a daily basis.

Wetu hopes to be an international businesswoman in the near future. She appreciates all Kiva lenders for supporting this program.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes, as her customers increase on a daily basis.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 25 years old and a mother of a ten-year-old child. They live in the town of West Point. Her child is already in school. She is a high school graduate. Over the past five years, she has been selling cold water. She buys her supply at the local water factory in West Point by the sack and resells it in the local market in her community.

Janet has requested a loan to purchase more water by the sack to resell. Her favorite part of the year is the dry season because it's the time when she makes more money. She hopes to make more profit to be able to give her child quality education and to one day own a house. She thanks BRAC for their assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack to resell.

loans.name: Mamekor

texts.en:
30-year-old Mamekor lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has three children ages 17, 12 and 6. Her children are attending school and living at home. She is a high school graduate who is now selling sugar and flour by the cup to make her life and children's lives better; and considers herself a hard working business woman. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 7 hours on her business since she has to go home early to prepare food for her family at home.

Mamekor has requested a loan to purchase more flour and sugar by bags so that she can increase her daily sale. She hopes to be an international business woman one day and she hopes to have her own house. She is happy to be a BRAC Liberia borrower.

loans.use: to purchase more flour and sugar by bags so that she can increase her daily sale.

loans.name: Lucy Griselda

texts.es:
La señora Lucy Griselda,  de 32  años de edad es casada no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de Choluteca en la zona sur de Honduras.

Doña Lucy Griselda se dedica desde 06 años al negocio de venta de productos alimenticios, su pulpería está ubicada en su casa y sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, también  tiene videos juegos en su negocio que es otra fuente de ingreso.

Doña Lucy Griselda es una mujer muy trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para surtir su pulpería comprando agua, leche, azúcar, frijoles, café, pan, huevos, etc. porque necesita estos productos que sus clientes le piden, con el apoyo del préstamo ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, su sueño es tener el mejor negocio de la zona.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Lucy Griselda is 32 years old and married. She doesn't have children dependent on her. She lives in a community of Choluteca in the southern part of Honduras. 

Lucy Griselda has worked for six years in the business of selling food products. Her small grocery store is located in her house and she is open from Monday to Sunday. She also has video games in her shop, which are another source of income. 

Lucy Griselda is a very hardworking woman with a desire to get ahead. She is requesting the loan to stock her shop by buying water, milk, sugar, beans, coffee, bread, eggs, etc.; she needs these products because her customers are requesting them. With the support of the loan, she plans to improve her income and thus her quality of life. Her dream is to have the best shop in the area.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2013.

loans.use: to buy water, milk, sugar, beans, coffee, bread, eggs, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 35 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has 4 children. She was not able to complete school because she stopped in the 9th grade, but all her children are currently in school. Her husband works as a driver. Susan has a business selling meat, which she has had for three years. Some days the business is good; some others are very slow. She started the business when her brother gave her some money. Now she is proud to support herself and her children.  

Susan has requested a loan to purchase meat to resell. In the future, Susan hopes to build a house. She wants to be in good health so she can pay back the money and keep supporting her children. She promises to pay back this loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase meat to resell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Bandu is 33 years old and lives in the town of West Point. Her parent was not able to send her to school, but she believes that she is good at taking care of her business and her home affairs. She is not yet married but she and her fiance are living together. They have three children aged between 18 and 7. All three of them are attending school. 

For five years now Bandu has been selling pepper, oil, bitter ball, okra, vita, etc. Some days the business is good; other days it's not. She learned how to do this business from her mother, and the best part of her work is that it keeps her busy. She sells six days in a week for 10 hours each day. Most often she uses a taxi to take her goods to her table business. 

She established this business by selling cold water around from a wheelbarrow for two years, and she learned many ways of selling from her friends. She is glad today that she is independent. Bandu has requested a loan to purchase pepper, oil, bitter ball, okra, vita, etc. to increase her sales. In the future, she would like to have her own house and educate her children. She thanks BRAC and its supporters.

loans.use: to purchase pepper, oil, bitter ball, okra, vita, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en: A villager from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Vannak is 30 years old and has two kids who are in school. Currently, her main source of income relies on her one hectare cassava farming area and on working for others for a fee for extra income. Vannak is not new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The successful earlier loan, which she has repaid, has left her family better off than before. Now, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay a weeding fee and to combine with her savings to buy a decent motorbike for commuting. She hopes that her business will grow significantly and provide her with a good income.

loans.use: To pay a weeding fee

loans.name: Namutamba Twekembe Group

texts.en:
Robert is a hard working 47-year-old man who lives in rural Lyantonde. He keeps cattle to make a living. He rears them and later sells when they have matured. He supplements the income from the cattle with sale of milk.

He does this on a small scale because they lack a dairy in a nearby location. He hopes to acquire a bigger loan in the future to buy more milk from the neighbors so that his home will be a collecting centre for the milk; he will not need to spend on transport which will increase his profits. He thanks Kiva for partnering with Ugafode to extend their outreach to the rural areas.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy display cases, cellular accessories and stationery

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron is a Tlaxcalan dairy producer whose family has been dedicated to farming for generations. However, times are tough due to weak milk prices. As the dairy farm represents his primary source of income, he is constantly looking at ways to reduce his operating costs. 

His 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow him to reduce his energy and fertilizer costs, as well as give better treatment to his animal waste. His cow manure will be processed by the digester into renewable methane-rich biogas and biofertilizer, allowing him to reduce his dependence on costly and damaging liquefied petroleum gas and agrochemical fertilizers that degrade soils and contaminate groundwater. 

This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a hardworking and innovative farmer who works at creating harmony between herself, her agricultural production, and her environment. She is excited about showing her children the importance of protecting nature, and her 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow her to continue her family farm while dramatically reducing its environmental impact.

By using the digester to treat the abundant cow manure on her site, she will reduce greenhouse gas emissions and water contamination while concurrently allowing her family to displace liquefied petroleum gas with free, renewable biogas. This loan represents 49% of the total cost of her Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Sumaria's Group

texts.en:
Sumaria is a 35-year-old hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and one son. Her son is currently studying in primary school. Sumaria’s husband does construction work but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Sumaria is a very hardworking and responsible woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her son's educational expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past 8 years, and her clients always appreciate her work. 

As a member of a two-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is a 37-year-old hardworking mother of six children. She and her husband are crockery sellers. Basheeran has some enterprising skills and she has been running this small business, selling crockery for households, for 13 years. Her business is increasing with the passage of time. 

Currently she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will purchase new crockery items and utensils like plates, glasses, spoons, forks, etc. so that her sales will be increased. With the profit amount, Basheeran will pay the tuition fees for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and is very hopeful for her children's bright future.

loans.use: to purchase crockery items like plates, glasses, spoons and forks.

loans.name: Razai

texts.en:
Razai is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is the mother of 5 children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband is in the business of doing house maintenance. 

Razai has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. With the help of the loan amount her husband will purchase bricks, cement and other construction materials for house maintenance. By doing so he will easily increase his net income and savings for the future. 

Razai is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase cement and other construction materials for house maintenance.

loans.name: Alonzo De Mendoza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALONZO DE MENDOZA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Candelaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chancletas, venta dulces, venta de verduras, tejido a máquina, venta de tennis, venta de ropa, venta de fruta

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Candelaria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de fruta; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace siete años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito,  ahorro, las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Alonzo de Mendoza” is in its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors led by Sra. Candelaria as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling flip-flops, selling candy, selling vegetables, knitting with machines, selling tennis shoes, selling clothes, and selling fruit.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Candelaria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization. Candelaria currently has a business of selling fruit. She gained knowledge about this trade after she established this business on her own seven years ago.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fruit, which she acquires from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She then sells these products from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to sustain her family. Candelaria is married and has three children.

When asked she likes about Pro Mujer, Candelaria said that she enjoys the loans, the savings, the training classes, and the health services.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Kin's Group

texts.en:
Kin, 39, is from a rural village located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with three children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava on almost 6 hectares of farmland. She and her husband have been in this business for 20 years. To better feed her family, she and her husband also farm rice, which they have been doing this year. The current business earns her family about 30,000KHR per day.

This is Khim’s group micro-loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund. As the leader, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan and she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and she will use a portion of it to spend for land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat is 59 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer of 2 hectares of farmland, and she has been in this business for almost 30 years. The current business earns her family about 24,000KHR per day to feed the family, but she also manages to save about 10,000KHR each day.

This is the first loan for Yat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ma

texts.en:
Residing in the Trang district of Takeo province, Ma is 25 years old and he is single. He earns a living through working at an organization in the village. Having been in this job for two years, Ma is able to earn about US$6 per day and he manages to save about US$5 each day after daily expenses. 

Ma has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, he is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund to cover the entire tuition fees for his university studies, specializing in Management. He hopes this loan will enable him to keep studying until graduation in order to get a good job so as to support and improve the family.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fees for his university studies.

loans.name: Chet's Group

texts.en:
Chet is a 30-year-old mother of three children living in a rural village of the Srey Snom district, Cambodia. All of her children are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava. The current business earns her about 30,000KHR per day.
 
This is the first micro-loan for Chet’s group of three with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Chet, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Samrach's Group

texts.en:
A 58-year-old widowed mother of one, Samrach lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province where she manages two hectares of cassava farming and another two hectares of rice farming. She has been involved in this business since she was 20 years old.

Samrach, as part of a group of two, is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner VisionFund. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and insecticide to support her farmland. Samrach strongly believes that she can gain a good yield from her cash crops and produce more yields.

loans.use: To buy potash and insecticide to support her farmland

loans.name: Himelda

texts.es: Himelda tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Soledad, departamento del Atlántico. Este municipio es reconocido nacionalmente por ser la cuna en el país de la butifarra, embutido de origen catalán, que es una de las insignias culinarias de la Costa Caribe. Su principal fuente hídrica es el río Magdalena, que bordea todo el municipio al oriente. Reside en este municipio con su conyugue y dos (2) hijos varones, uno de veintitrés (23) años y otro de veintisiete (27) años de edad. Su actividad de negocio consiste en la comercialización de ropa y perfumes, de forma domiciliaria a vecinos del sector donde reside, a familiares y a referidos. Compra de contado en almacenes del mercado central de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Todos los días ejerce este actividad, la cual inició hace 10 años, cuando le nació la idea tener su propio negocio. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de ropa, perfumes y vitrinas. Con esta inversión mejorará la atención a los clientes, por la oferta de productos y el cambio en la infraestructura. Sus metas son: A corto plazo, crecer económicamente para tener un mejor bienestar familiar; y a largo plazo, comprar una Vans para facilitar el transporte de compra y entrega de mercancías, y tener otra casa.
texts.en:
Himelda, 54, lives in the town of Soledad in the Atlántico department.  This town is known nationally for being the Colombian birthplace of butifarra, a Catalonian sausage that is one of the culinary emblems of the Caribbean coast.  The area's main water source is the Magdalena River, which borders the town to the East. 

Himelda lives in this town with her husband and 2 sons, who are 23 and 27 years old.  Her business involves selling clothing and perfumes door-to-door to the neighbors in the area where she lives, and to family members and referrals.  She buys in cash at from the stores in the central market of the city of Barranquilla.  She works in this business every day.  She started it 10 years ago, when she got the idea to have her own business.  

This is Himelda's first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy clothing, perfumes and glass display cases.  With this investment, she will provide better service to her customers, offering more products and improving her business infrastructure.  Himelda's goals are: in the short run, to grow financially so as to improve her family's well-being, and in the long run, to buy a van to transport and deliver merchandise, and to have another house.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes and display cases

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a 31-year-old hardworking married woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and 5 daughters. For the past 10 years she and her husband have been running a crockery shop in the market. 

Sabreen has requested a loan from KIVA partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase crockery items, like glasses, plates, spoons and forks, etc. for her crockery shop, so that she can offer more of a variety of goods to her clients, and as a result increase her net income in the future. 

She dreams of opening a new shop. She is hopeful that her business will grow more in the future. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase crockery items, like glasses, plates, spoons and forks.

loans.name: Nazeefar's Group

texts.en:
Nazeefar is a 32-year-old hardworking mother of three children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is doing private jobs and he has a very low monthly income. 

Nazeefar has been doing tailoring work for four years. She, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. 

She would be able to stitch dresses more appropriately and efficiently in less time with a new sewing machine. This would increase her net income and savings. She would spend the profit amount on the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more sewing machine.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia es soltera y vive con su madre en la ciudad de La Paz. Es estudiante de ingenieria industrial y ademas trabaja como comerciante de artesanía boliviana.Ella requiere el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y así poder ampliar un poco mas su negocio.

El sueño de Flavia es terminar sus estudios y poder independizarse y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
Flavia is single and lives with her mother in the city of La Paz. She is an Industrial Engineering student, but she also works as a merchant of Bolivian handicrafts. Flavia needs a loan so that she can buy more merchandise and expand her business a bit more.

Her dream is to finish her studies so that she can become independent and pursue her profession.

loans.use: to buy more handicrafts to sell in her business.

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
"Z’s Piñatas & More" has yet to open, but Donna already has major plans to create a successful business. For at least five years, Donna worked in the party supply industry and recently decided to take the challenge of working for herself.

Before she could open her newly-rented storefront, Donna needed working capital to purchase moonwalks to rent out, and piñatas, candy, decorations, balloons and other party supplies to sell in her town of Nixon, Texas, serving the San Antonio area. She then ventured to ACCION Texas Inc. for a business loan and was approved for funds to begin her business. She plans to recruit customers through a major grand opening with support from ads in local newspapers and on radio stations.

Donna understands she is in charge of the longevity of her business. As it is one of plenty of piñata stores serving San Antonio, Donna says she is ready to provide exceptional customer service, competitive prices, and high quality and unique products to keep clients returning for every occasion.

loans.use: to purchase moonwalks to rent out, and piñatas, candy, decorations, balloons and other party supplies to sell.

loans.name: Khoern's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Srey Snom district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Khoern is a 49-year-old mother of three children. Rice farming and cassava growing, which she and her husband have been doing for several years, are the main sources of the family’s income.

This is the first loan for Khoern with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Khoern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source of family income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Tae's Group

texts.en:
Tae, 46, is married with two children and resides in a rural village of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for twenty-eight years. She can earn about KHR25,000 per day and can save about KHR10,000 each day for future needs. 

Tae’s group consists of two members who are both female, and she has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Tae completely paid back the loan with VisionFund and successfully used the loan to better support her family. Now, she and her group member are applying for a loan. As the leader, Tae will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1994. She lives in Thai Binh. She is learning economic law at Hanoi University of Law (http://www.hlu.edu.vn/). Her course lasts 48 months and she will be graduated in 2016. Her education fee is subsidized by her parents. Hang plans to find a part-time job to have more money to pay her education fees and to pay tuition for a private class in English.  

Hang’s family has five members. She is the first person in her family to graduate high school and to go on to a higher education. Her parents raise porcupines to make a living. Her family’s income is about 7,000,000VND per month. When Hang was a child, she wanted to become a lawyer to contribute to community development, and now her passion is fulfilled through her major. She wants to continue until the end of this university course. She understands that learning helps her have qualifications to get a high-paid job, so as to bring income to her family. 

She wants to borrow 10,206,000 VND to pay her education fees and buy a computer to support her studying. If she couldn’t have access to this loan, her studying would have to be interrupted.  She appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. This has contributed a lot for the education of students in Vietnam. She also hopes this program could be expanded more to help more students.

loans.use: to pay her education fees and buy a computer to support her studying.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en: Sorn is 34 and a parent of three children, two schoolchildren and one little kid. He and the rest of his family are living in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. To earn a living, he does rice cropping, pig-raising, and brown sugar producing. He has 11 years of experience in his business. Sorn is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully paid back his past loan wisely to improve his lifestyle better than before; especially he can afford to renovate his house timely. Now, he is in a group of two to apply for a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy potash and to pay for plowing fee plus labor cost. He hopes to boost his cash-crop seasonally so he can make more money to buy a decent motorbike for his small-scale trading business.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay for plowing fee plus labor cost

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mausauri

texts.es:
