Mausauri nació en la provincia de Paucartambo, él tiene 32 años de edad y es una persona  trabajadora y responsable que sale adelante con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de útiles de escritorio por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros, papeles y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Mausauri was born in the province of Paucartambo. He is 32 years old and a hardworking and responsible person who is able to get ahead as a result of the effort from his work. Mausauri has a business of selling writing supplies, so he is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pens, paper, and other items. He is grateful to those who have helped him fulfill his dream in this manner.

Mausauri values this loan and promises to complete his monthly payments with great responsibility. He is a member of the Communal Bank “San Martincito”, which is affiliated with Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, paper, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Isla en la ciudad de Guayaquil.  Empezó tiempo atrás vendiendo helados y gelatinas, luego incrementó su oferta y en la actualidad vende productos naturales y recargas celulares.  Esto le ha ayudado de gran forma a sustentar los gastos de su hogar.  Trabaja sola, de 8 am a 7 pm.  No es casada, pero tiene un hijo de 8 años que tiene una condición especial y asiste a la escuela fiscal de su zona.  Necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería (productos naturales) y recargas.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Isla sector in the city of Guayaquil. Some time ago, she started out selling ice cream and gelatins, but she later increased her offerings and now sells natural products and reloadable mobile phone cards. Her business has been a great help with maintaining the household expenses.

The borrower works alone from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. She is not married and has an eight-year-old son who has a special condition. He attends a state school in the area. The borrower needs a loan so that she can buy merchandise, including natural products and reloadable phone cards.

loans.use: to buy natural products and reloadable phone cards.

loans.name: Emerald

texts.en:
Emerald is new to the cleaning industry but is fulfilling her dream of owning her own business and being her own boss.  Holy Hands Cleaning Services has only been in business for about six months but Emerald already has big plans.

The main goal for Holy Hands is to gain the trust and support of each of their clients. Her current clients are residential home owners looking for cleaning services such as, vacuuming, mopping, dusting, and laundry services.  The business provides reasonable rates for any budget.

Emerald gains additional clients by utilizing her improved website, http://holyhands31ef.wix.com/cleaningservices#, by word of mouth, and referrals.

Searching for help to finance her start-up business, Emerald found Accion Texas Inc. With her loan, she purchased a van, uniforms, cleaning equipment, marketing materials and website, and office equipment to start her business and is now able to offer more services to new and returning clients.

loans.use: to purchase a van, uniforms, cleaning equipment, marketing materials and website, and office equipment

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom is 47 years old and married. The rest of her family is residing in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She has four children, one of whom is still in school. To support her family, she and her husband plant rice on a two-hectare area. This is the business that she has had for 10 years. Mom is not a new client to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Wisely, she has fully repaid back her past loan to her business, and her living is better than before. Interestingly, she can afford to keep her kids in school and provide good food for them. Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy five sacks of fertilizer to support her agribusiness. She fully believes that she can make more income and sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run, 32, is a father of three little kids residing in Battambang province where he does paddy rice farming on a five-hectare area. He supplements his family income via a mine (mineral) digging business. Run has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. He is now taking a new loan to buy necessary materials to support his mine digging business. He hopes that he can make more income and relieve his family's burdens better than before.

loans.use: To buy necessary material to support his mine digging business.

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en:
Nang, originally from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, is 55 years old and a mother of four children. She manages her daily cost of living via one hectare of rice cropping and another one hectare of cassava farming with support from her husband. She has been involved in her current business for 25 years, earning about 17,500 KHR per day.

Nang is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has paid back with success, has enabled her to relieve her family's burdens better than before. Now, she leads a group consisting of two females, including herself, to apply for a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to pay a weeding fee, and to buy potash and seedlings for replanting. She highly hopes that she can make more income and maintain the good pace of her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay a weeding fee, and to buy potash and seedlings for replanting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her niece's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is Jane. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She had her washing machine maintained and she was able to cater to more customers. She was able to buy the sacks of rice that she needed and sold them. Her income from her businesses helped in the studies of her child. She also sells herbal products and gulaman con sago (gelatin and pearls) for additional income. She and her husband, who works in an office, are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy more herbal medicines and food supplements that she will sell to her customers. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jane hopes to have her own stall for her business and dreams to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more herbal medicines and food supplements that she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn, a rural villager from Bati province's Takeo district, is 41 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been earning a living by weaving scarves and silk for almost ten years. Sorn is able to save up to US$5 per day from her current business, after deducting the expenses. This is the sixth loan cycle for Sorn with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The past loans, which she successfully paid back, have helped her better support her family, with enough food. She is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter to study to become an accountant. She very much hopes that this loan will enable her daughter to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter to study to become an accountant.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en: Ley is 40 years old, living with her husband and seven children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. Two of her children are still in school. Rice farming is the source of her family’s income, and she has been growing rice on a five-hectare area farm for about 10 years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 26,000 KHR, and she is able to save 10,000 KHR each day. This is the fourth loan for Ley from VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy, so as to sell the rice for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her rice farm.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian, con 19 años de edad es un joven emprendedor y muy activo. Después de haber terminado sus estudios secundarios, se dedicó a capacitarse en el área de corte y barbería; gracias a esto, pudo emplearse en una barbería donde adquirió experiencia laboral y adicionalmente tuvo la oportunidad de ahorrar dinero, con el cual pudo independizarse. Montó su propio negocio en un local arrendado, en el que labora de lunes a domingo de 10:00 am hasta las 9:30 pm y cuenta con el apoyo de un trabajador al cual le paga por porcentaje, de acuerdo a los cortes que realice. Esto le ha permitido a Cristian obtener los recursos necesarios para aportar al sostenimiento y sustento diario de su familia. El joven se motivó a solicitar el crédito, ya que requiere comprar activos fijos (2 sillas de peluquería) con las cuales cambiará las que posee porque se encuentran en mal estado, de esta forma dará una mejor imagen a su negocio y podrá atraer más clientes y por ende aumentará sus ingresos.  Cristian sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, abrir otras sucursales y poder brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras personas, con lo que logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de muchas otras familias.
texts.en:
Cristian, 19 years old, is a enterprising and very active young man. Since completing his education, he has worked to gain skills in cutting hair and hairdressing. Thanks to this, he has been employed at a barbershop where he acquired work experience and additionally he had the opportunity to save money, with which he was able to become independent. He established his own business in rented premises where he works Monday - Sunday from 10 am - 9:30 pm and has the support of a worker who he pays on commission according to the haircuts he carries out. This has allowed Cristian to obtain the necessary resources to support and feed his family. 

This young man is asking for a loan as he needs to buy fixed assets (two barber's chairs) with which he will replace those he has currently as they are in bad condition. This way, he will improve his business' image and be able to attract more clients, and so increase his income. Cristian's dream is to expand his business, open other branches and be able to offer employment opportunities to others, and so be able to improve the quality of life of many other families.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (2 barber's chairs)

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: Chanthorn, 38, lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district has four children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she and her husband grow rice and sell vegetables. She and her husband have been in this business for several years. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. This is the first micro-loan for Chanthorn from VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. Chanthorn will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Choun's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Choun, 50, has two children. Choun and her husband are rice farmers, who have been farming for ten years to make a living. She can earn about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Choun has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back her loans, which have helped her improve livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice in a healthy way and also hopes to produce more rice, to better her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Chandy's Group

texts.en: Chandy, 33, lives with her husband and two children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. All of her children are still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs for several years. Chandy has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three loan cycles and has completely paid back her loans. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood and to send her children to school and keep them there. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy and will use a portion of it to pay for labor. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: Thy, 41, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Dambae district in Cambodia. To feed the family, Thy and her husband earn a living as farmers, and they have been growing rice and cassava for 20 years, earning about 19,000 KHR per day to spend on the family’s needs. This is Thy’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and her group has only three members, all of whom live in the same village. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en: Yorn, 60, is married and has seven dependent children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, and the main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and growing cassava in her village. She has been running her business for 40 years, earning about KHR 18,000 per day, and she is able to save about KHR 10,000 each day. Yorn is beginning with VisionFund this cycle. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. Yorn, the leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her nephew's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en: Thanks to the money from his previous loan, Vitaliy was able to make car repairs. Being in the transportation business, Vitaliy knows that the car's condition is of the greatest importance.  Vitaliy also decided to try trade. He began using his vehicle to buy vegetables in bulk and sell them at retail. Vitaliy's wife helps him with the retail sales. Summer time is a high season for vegetable sales. Vitaliy is applying for a loan of 24,000 UAH to increase the assortment of fruits and vegetables they have to sell. There was a big event in Vitaliy's family -- his daughter got married! He is happy for the daughter, and now he looks forward to grandchildren.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of fruits and vegetables he has to sell.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.en:
Zulema did not have much experience in the locksmith business but that did not stop her dream of becoming a business owner. Opening up Corona’s Locksmith in El Paso, Texas recently, Zulema began her journey for financial assistance at Wells Fargo Bank.

While at Wells Fargo, the banker recommended she talk to Accion Texas Inc., the nation’s largest microlender.

After Zulema consulted with an Accion loan officer, she applied for a microloan and received funds to purchase locks, keys, promotional materials to advertise, pay for rental space, begin her start-up business, and pay salaries for two employees.  The loan allowed Zulema to create jobs in the El Paso market and provide a much-needed service, too.  

Zulema offers custom-made keys, sells and installs alarm systems, sells locks, and offers many other services.  Currently she has two employees and has plans to expand to other locations.  She is grateful to have received this loan because without it, she would not have been able to start her business.  Other plans include creating a website, but for now she uses word of mouth and promotional materials to market her business.

loans.use: to purchase locks, keys, promotional materials to advertise, pay for rental space, begin her start-up business, and pay salaries for two employees.

loans.name: Ngin's Group

texts.en: Ngin is 34 and married. She has four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Living in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Ngin has been farming rice and growing cassava for several years. The current business earns her about 13,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. This is the first loan for Ngin from VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vichey

texts.en: Vichey, a rural villager from Banteay Meanchey province's Ou Chrov district, is 27 years old. He earns a living by working at a company in the local area. Having been in this job for one year, Vichey can earn about 15,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. This is the first loan cycle for Vichey with VisionFund. He is applying for an education loan to pay for the entire tuition fee to study law. He highly hopes that this loan will enable him to obtain a higher education background.

loans.use: to pay for the entire tuition fee to study law.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Ou Chrov Dristrict
